title: Extrusion Technician 2nd Shift
description:
**About Us**
------------


Cornerstone Building Brands is a premier exterior building solutions provider serving both the residential and commercial markets across North America. The building products we manufacture are the cornerstone of the communities where people live, work and play -from homes to hospitals, grade schools to grocery stores, manufacturing facilities to municipal buildings and beyond.



Through the core values and consistent behaviors and mindsets embraced by our employees, we have built a culture dedicated to understanding our customers' needs and what matters most to their success. We know that it's our people that make the difference and we are deeply committed to building a workplace and global community where inclusion is not only valued, but prioritized, providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and team members.


**Company description**
-----------------------


Cornerstone Building Brands is the largest manufacturer of exterior building products in North America. Our comprehensive portfolio spans the breadth of the residential and commercial markets, while our expansive footprint enables us to serve customers and communities across North America. Our relentless focus on excellence combined with our ongoing commitment to innovation and R&D has driven us to become the #1 manufacturer of windows, vinyl siding, insulated metal panels, metal roofing and wall systems, and metal accessories. We believe every building we create, and every part of that building, positively contributes to communities where people live, work and play.


**Job description**
-------------------


**JOB DETAILS**

**Base pay** **$23-$26 per hour,**

**2nd Shift: 3:00 pm - 11:30 pm**

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**


Provide extrusion troubleshooting services to production as needed to resolve problems, including process modifications, tooling alterations to maintain a process capable of meeting customer requirements. In addition to troubleshooting, tool maintenance and minor flow adjustments will be performed as necessary, along with process improvements to maintain a competitive productivity level.

* Able to assess a situation and determine if an issue is machine related or process related and take corrective action
* Efficiently work on non-conforming processes to get them in specification
* Diagnose complex extrusion problems to resolve issues, inclusive of flow corrections
* Work with the supervisor, lead, engineering, and maintenance to resolve complex issues
* Assist with production qualification runs including capability assessment
* Participate in and support projects that are driven by business initiatives
* Provide training, instruction, and guidance to production associates
* Support, train, and assess associate learned skills through the Pay for Skills program
* Work in a safe manner and follow safety policies. Ensure co-workers are working safely and following safety policies
* Train new operators
* Analyze SPC data to determine process/product conformance and trends
* Analyze production data and make necessary adjustments to operation of machines within the work cell
* Identify and communicate appropriately when electrical/mechanical/technical support is needed
* Participate and sustain 5S activities
* Participate in and lead kaizen events and sustain improvements from those events
* Maintain and develop back-up tooling and transition tooling into production
* Help transition and qualify new materials, processes, and profile applications
* Identify and implement process improvement concepts
* Help to identify and assist with experiments aimed at reducing customer related concerns, improving process capability and tooling longevity
* Help develop and train associates
* Conduct and provide feedback where applicable for associates
* Participate and support projects that are driven by business initiatives
* Set-up and start-up any profile for all machines in a work cell
* Tend to and operate machines in a work cell to produce required parts as determined by customer requirements and the production schedule
* Perform maintenance tasks as necessary
* Attend and participate in appropriate training and development programs
* Perform other duties across the plant as needed as directed by supervision or management
* Assists crew lead and supervisor with the training and development of entry level and senior level operators


**Qualifications**
------------------


* Experience with profile extrusion.
* Strong prioritization and multi-tasking capability.
* Strong aptitude in problem solving and process improvement.
* Strong computer skills – Windows, MS Access, MS Excel
* Equipment maintenance experience
* Ability to articulate problems and solutions verbally.
* Ability to read and comprehend written instructions and process procedures.
* Ability and skills to collaborate effectively in a team environment.
* Self-motivated and capable of managing stressful situations.
* Be able to lift 50 pounds.


**Additional information**
--------------------------


Site Location: 1 Silverline Dr. North Brunswick Township, NJ 08902

**Why work for Cornerstone Building Brands?**


Our teams are at the heart of our purpose to positively contribute to the communities where we **live, work and play**. Full-time\\* team members receive\\*\\* medical, dental and vision benefits starting day 1. Other benefits include PTO, paid holidays, FSA, life insurance, LTD, STD, 401k, EAP, discount programs, tuition reimbursement, training, and professional development. You can also join one of our Employee Resource Groups which help support our commitment to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment.


\\*Full-time is defined as regularly working 30+ hours per week. \\*\\*Union programs may vary depending on the collective bargaining agreement.


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


**Videos To Watch**
-------------------


**Job location**
----------------


Cornerstone Building Brands is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability. You can find the Equal Employment Opportunity Poster here. You can also view Your Right to Work Poster here along with This Organizations Participation in E-Verify Poster here. If you'd like to view a copy of the company's affirmative action plan or policy statement, please contact Human Resources at 281-897-7788 or HRCompliance@cornerstone-bb.com. If you have a disability and you believe that you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to submit an online application, please contact Human Resources at 281-897-7788 or HRCompliance@cornerstone-bb.com. This email is used exclusively to assist disabled job seekers whose disability prevents them from being able to apply online. Only emails received for this purpose will be returned. Messages left for other purposes, such as following up on an application or technical issues not related to a disability, will not receive a response.



California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) of 2018


**Notice of Recruitment Fraud**



We have been made aware of multiple scams whereby unauthorized individuals are using Cornerstone Building Brands name and logo to solicit potential job-seekers for employment. In some cases, job-seekers are being contacted directly, both by phone and e-mail. In other instances, these unauthorized individuals are placing advertisements for fake positions with both legitimate websites and fabricated ones. These individuals are typically promising high-paying jobs with the requirement that the job-seeker send money to pay for things such as visa applications or processing fees. Please be advised that Cornerstone Building Brands will never ask potential job-seekers for any sort of advance payment or bank account information as part of the recruiting or hiring process.

description:

**SCHEDULE:** Monday-Friday 2:15-6:00 pm. Availability for all of these hours is essential.

**Overview**:

PS10 Extended Day is looking for part-time Group Leaders for our in-person program**.** We are looking for energetic and enthusiastic staff who are dedicated to the growth and development of children to join our unique enrichment-based program.

The ideal candidate would be a proactive problem-solver. A positive, caring, and fun attitude combined with creativity, innovation, and passion for working with children is essential. Group Leaders are expected to help create an environment that encourages children's creative thinking, verbal communication, independent exploration, self-confidence, self-awareness, and well-being. We will work together to make you and this program the best we can be!

**General Duties:**

Under the guidance of the Program Director, the Group Leader will assist with the implementation of the PS 10 Extended Day program. The Group Leader is responsible for helping to maintain a safe, clean program site; ensuring a high level of program quality and working to establish a positive relationship with all program participants and their families. The Group Leader will be a positive role model to youth within the philosophy of the PS 10 Extended Day standards.

**Group Leader / Teacher Assistant Principal Duties:**

- Supervise children, prioritizing safety, according to the PS 10 safety policy.  
- Participate and encourage positive participation of all students in daily activities and events.  
- Under the Teaching Artist's supervision, help implement the day’s activity.  
- Lead organized learning activities for students to develop and strengthen their academic,  
physical, and social skills.  
- Differentiate lessons and activities to be appropriate to students with various  
abilities.  
- Participate in and evaluate the effectiveness of activities and events.  
- Instruct students on the safe and proper use of supplies and equipment.  
- Implement positive discipline techniques and classroom management.  
- Participate in cleaning, disinfecting, sanitizing and maintaining the facilities and equipment.  
- Inspect the school site and the equipment for potential safety hazards; take corrective  
action to prevent injuries.  
- Interact professionally and appropriately with parents, teachers, school staff and Extended  
Day staff.  
- Participate in school site staff meetings and ongoing training opportunities.  
- Attend mandatory staff meetings, training, and special events as required by the program.  
- Follow PS 10 Extended Day policies and procedures including the discipline code.  
- All other pertaining duties as indicated by the Director, Assistant Director or Senior Group  
Leader

**Knowledge, Skills, and Qualifications**:

* Must be 18-years-old or older
* Minimum H.S. diploma/GED
* Must be able to climb stairs, stand for long periods and lift at least 40 pounds
* Minimum 1 year of experience working with youth from 5 to 11 years old.
* Willingness to take initial and monthly background checks.
* Ability to provide at least 1 personal and 1 professional work reference from a supervisor.
* Ability to arrive early, or on time, properly prepared for work.
* Ability to care about, understand, listen to, nurture, support, and accept all children.
* Must be a team player with the ability to work toward the shared goal of maintaining the high standards of the PS10 Extended Days program.
* Ability to build and maintain positive and respectful relationships with families, students and co-workers of diverse backgrounds and identities.
* Excellent communication skills, ability to articulate ideas and knowledge clearly.
* Willingness to hear feedback to improve performance and outcomes.
* Must possess strong classroom management skills.
* Able to develop lesson plans, teaching and designing curricula is a strong plus.

**Additional advantages**:

* Valid CPR/AED Pro certification through recognized accrediting body preferred.
* Valid First Aid/RTE certification through recognized accrediting body preferred.
* Fluency in Spanish a plus.

**About PS10 Extended Day**  
PS 10 Extended Day is a parent created, PTA overseen low-cost high-quality enrichment-based afterschool program dedicated to providing a safe and nurturing afterschool environment for the diverse community of PS10 Elementary School. We believe an exposure to a wide range of activities and disciplines help children discover their interests & passions early on, and develop self-esteem & confidence while learning to be curious and proactive learners.

**How to apply:**

Please apply with a resume. Applications submitted without a resume will not be considered. Only candidates being considered for the position will be contacted. To be considered applicants must supply two professional references from supervisors.

*The PTA of PS10 is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.*

description:
**Job Summary**

The Health Educator is responsible for conducting community outreach and facilitating the Maurer Foundation’s Breast Health Education program to audiences ranging from high school/college students to community/corporate groups. title: Regional ALS Education Specialist
description:
At Saint Clare's Health, our dedicated team of professionals is committed to our core values of quality, compassion, and community. As a member of Prime Healthcare, Saint Clare's Health is actively seeking new members to join its award-winning team!

Saint Clare's Health includes CMS 5-Star Rated hospitals and is an award-winning provider of safe, high quality, compassionate care, serving the communities of Morris, Warren and Sussex counties. Its network of hospitals and healthcare facilities include Denville Hospital, Dover Hospital, Behavioral Health Centers in Boonton, Denville, and Parsippany, and an Imaging Center in Parsippany, among other satellite locations. The hospitals have received multiple quality awards including Leapfrog “A” ratings for patient safety; Healthgrades recognition for orthopedic surgery, treatment of stroke, heart care, various surgical procedures, and more. For information, visit www.saintclares.com.

The educator will provide initial and follow up education with a continued needs assessment to ensure that staff is competent to respond/treat patients who are experiencing life threatening events under the guidelines of the American Red Cross and the American Heart Association. title: Outside Sales Representative - Kitchen Remodeling
description:
Kitchen Saver

We are a premier remodeling company that specializes in solutions that make a major improvement in people's lives and homes faster and for less cost than traditional methods. Kitchen Saver can transform a kitchen in as little as 3 days and saves money by using and improving existing cabinets and enhancing the functionality of the space. Every project is backed by a ten year warranty that covers both parts and labor. Being in business for 30 years, we have successfully completed over 20,000 installations and our list of satisfied customers continues to grow. Kitchen Saver will exceed your expectations with superior quality and value you will have to see to believe. And we enjoy a competitive price advantage compared to traditional solutions.

You apply your sales creativity helping clients with finishes, hardware, countertop, storage and access solutions to transform this most important room in the house. You provide each homeowner with a complete, professional and compelling presentation of Kitchen Saver products and services to help them design a custom solution for their home. Our project management team takes it from there through to installation so you can move ahead to help the next customer.

As part of one of the nation's ten largest home remodeling companies we continue to grow each year. Each office has a marketing team that focuses on the local community at retail locations, malls, and events where thousands of people are exposed to our message to find you customers. This allows our sales manager and representatives to focus on what they do best - HELP CUSTOMERS and MAKE SALES - without the headache of generating your own leads. Our top performers earn $250k++

The Opportunity

* Pre-Set Appointments - NO COLD CALLING. We conduct extensive marketing and advertising campaigns to find prospects that are screened and scheduled through our national call center. All appointments are confirmed for you as well.
* You are a W-2 employee with paychecks issued every two weeks.
* Health, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability Insurance coverage at 90 days.
* Training starts with a three week PAID program about our products and sales process. Continuous learning follows through your career.
* Our representatives have a solid six-figure income potential with experience.

Joining our team is more than a sales job, it truly is a career opportunity.

* $150+ Million Dollar organization spanning the Mid-Atlantic to the Midwest, 30+ offices in 15 states, with over 800 employees.
* Ranked as one of the Top Ten home remodeling companies IN THE NATION 16 times.
* Home improvement is a $350 BILLION industry projected to keep growing as more people prefer to keep and upgrade their homes rather than sell and buy another one. Your long-term earning potential is unlimited.

Responsibilities

* Use proven sales and process methods to inform the homeowner.
* Focus during every appointment on the needs of that customer.
* Become expert on the products and their benefits.
* Ensure accuracy of all paperwork.
* Meet or exceed closing sales objectives within company guidelines.

Qualifications

* Confidence and commitment to succeed.
* Many of our most successful people have come from direct sales backgrounds such as autos, mortgages, energy, and insurance sales. While in-home sales experience is ideal, the ability to communicate is most critical and we have an extensive training program to develop the skills you need.
* Must be 21 years old with the ability to pass pre-employment background check and drug screening and have a valid driver’s license and ability to travel in the territory.

In Home Sales, residential, remodeling, sales, home improvement, flooring, roofing, windows, doors, cabinets, countertops, kitchen, bath, siding, direct sales, hardware, security,

title: AVP, Actuarial Services
description:
Summary:
* Oversee the development of pricing recommendations for all Commercial Business.
* Coordinate with UW including enhancement of UW Pricing Tools.
* Analytical/Actuarial support for Pharmacy business.
* Work closely with P&L Leadership, Sales, UW, Finance, and Product to develop pricing strategies to deliver on Financial Plan membership and margin commitments.
* Coordinate the actuarial staff as needed to support the activities of the affiliates.


Accountabilities:
* Work closely with Senior Product Management and Finance to analyze financial performance of blocks of business, including membership, trend, and financial analyses.
* Work collaboratively with all areas of the organization to identify opportunities to improve product performance.
* Lead analytical support and product/strategy evaluation of pharmacy experience and product designs.
* Oversee development and filing of premium rates for all products with the appropriate regulatory authority (e.g.,CMS, New York Dep’t of Health).
* Manage financial forecast for Commercial lines of business and evaluate emerging experience to identify variance drivers and potential action plans.
* Develop and grow business partner relationships and provide consultative support and insights to help influence the direction of the business.
* Manage and develop a high‐performing Actuarial team; build succession plans.
* Supervise and develop direct reports accountable for Medicare and State Sponsored areas, as well as other staff.
* Work closely with Risk Adjustment and other areas to optimize risk adjustment and related programs to increase EmblemHealth’s premium revenue for these segments.


Requirements:
* Bachelor’s degree in Actuarial Science, Mathematics, other physical science, or related finance/business degree required
* Associate of the Society of Actuaries (ASA) required
* Fellow of the Society of Actuaries (F.S.A.) preferred
* 12+ years of relevant, professional work experience and/or education required
* 10+ years of actuarial experience with ASA; or 8 + years’ experience with an FSA required
* 5+ year of management experience, preferably in the managed care industry required
* Comprehensive understanding of actuarial principles and methodologies with strong mathematical and analytical skills required
* Excellent written and oral communication skills to deliver complex information and achieve positive results required
* Capable with Excel, data extraction, simulations, automation required
* Proficiency with MS Office (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Outlook) required
* Knowledge of data querying skills using tools such as SQL or SAS Enterprise Guide required
* Knowledge of reimbursement methodologies required

title: Data Governance Analyst
description:
Summary of Position
* Serve asthe support liaison resource & translation layer between the business and the technical teams across all data domains to


include processes, procedures, and standards necessary to ensure data asset quality and usability.  

* Partner on monthly Data Governance activities related to gathering and coordinating of key data governance artifacts, inspect


input templatesto ensure completeness and consistency of information, preparing presentationsfor data governance Council  

activities and monthly newsletter prep work.  

* Responsible for routine checks of data governance dashboards, checking meta data content on Informatica CDGC Tool
* Manage SP documents relative to data governance and data quality work.
* Manage existing dashboards and assist with ingestion of data governance content including Business Glossaries, Reference code


Sets, BI Inventory, Data Dictionary etc.

Principal Accountabilities
* Support Data Council activities. Collaborate with data owners and stewards on the verification and the accuracy of the


information collected and document their approval.  

* Provide business centric technical support to Data Owners and Stewards on Data Domain activities by performing impact


analysis and conducting domain specific data profiling activities for critical data warehouse changes.  

* Work closely with Data Governance Team & business area(s) to document & support communication between relevant


groups/stakeholders.  

* Partner on Enterprise data communication activities. Co‐ordinate and maintain standard data governance input templates


to ingest foundational data assets to assure end to end data lineage form Source system of recordsto reporting data layer.  

* Engage in data and metric standardization with data owner and steward and solicit formal approval for adoption into data


dictionary and glossary to enable end‐users improved comprehension of which metricsto use and when to use them.  

* Provide support and direction to data owner and stewards on the usage of Informatica CDGC tool enforcing and promoting


adoption.  

* Enforce policies by monitoring changes and data quality metrics using Informatica.
* Maintain Informatica input templates; map glossaries, metrics etc.


Education, Training, Licenses, Certifications
* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, or a related field.
* Data Governance Certification (PMI or equivalent) preferred



Relevant Work Experience, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
* 4 – 6+ years of related overall professional experience, preferably in a healthcare provider environment. (R)
* 2 – 3+ years’ experience in a Data Warehouse/ BI environment providing reporting /analyticalsupport to end users. (R)
* 2 + years’ experience in a healthcare related role/function, such as a payer or third party administrator. (R)
* 1 + years’ experience working with Informatica CDGC Tool (R)
* Experience with standard terminologiesfor medical (ex. ICD‐10, CPT, HCPCS), lab (ex. LOINC) and pharmacy (ex. STC, NDC). (R)
* Strong experience in data profiling writing and executing queries in SQL. (R)
* Proficient in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, etc.). (R)
* Working knowledge of healthcare claim, provider, membership, and product relation/process/ function. (P)
* Excellent business requirements gathering and documenting skills. (R)
* Strong communication skills(verbal, written, presentation, interpersonal). (R)
* Proven ability to work with management and build relationships and trust with data users. (R)
* Data Governance experience. (P)

title: Surgical Coordinator
company: Coastal Ear, Nose and Throat, LLC
description:
**Summary:**  
Coastal Ear, Nose & Throat is seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Surgical Coordinator to join our team. The Surgical Coordinator will be responsible for managing the administrative aspects of surgical procedures and ensuring a smooth and efficient process for patients. This role requires strong communication skills, the ability to multitask, and a solid understanding of medical terminology and scheduling.

**Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:**  
- Receives instructions from physicians regarding scheduling needs, being able to communicate to patient

-Schedules operating room time, according to physician scheduling protocols; transmits required documents outside facilities.

- Coordinate surgical procedures by scheduling surgeries, pre-operative appointments, and post-operative follow-ups  
- Communicate with patients, physicians, and other healthcare professionals to ensure all necessary information is obtained and shared  
- Obtain insurance authorizations and verify patient eligibility for surgery  
- Prepare surgical charts, consent forms, and other necessary documents  
- Assist with patient registration and check-in process  
- Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of surgical procedures, including documentation of pre-operative instructions and post-operative care plans  
- Collaborate with the billing department to ensure accurate coding and billing for surgical procedures  
- Provide exceptional customer service to patients by addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and providing support throughout the surgical process

- Coordinates all business and clinical documentation prior to surgery; prepared documentation for physician signature

- Other duties as assigned

**Experience:**  
- Previous experience as a medical receptionist or in a similar patient service role  
- Proficiency in administrative tasks such as scheduling, record keeping, and data entry  
- Familiarity with electronic medical record systems (ModMed preferred)  
- Knowledge of medical terminology and surgical procedures  
- Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively  
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal  
- Ability to work well in a fast-paced environment while maintaining attention to detail

**Qualifications:**

* HS Diploma is required
* Surgical Coordinator 2 years’ experience
* Strong communication skills
* Strong computer skills
* Flexibility and willingness to adapt to change.

Note: This position will be required to commute between the Neptune and Holmdel location.

If you are looking for an opportunity to contribute to a dynamic healthcare team and make a difference in the lives of patients, we encourage you to apply for the position of Surgical Coordinator.

Coastal Ear, Nose & Throat (CENT) is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of any kind: CENT is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. title: NY No Fault Collections/Verification Specialist
description:
**Overview**  
We are seeking a dedicated Revenue Cycle Specialist to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in NY/NJ no fault collections, arbitration, and verifications claims.

We have an extensive suite of mental health services related to accidents both in worklpace and Personal Injury.

* The No Fault/Liens claims associate is responsible for the independent, prompt, and efficient evaluation, investigation, and resolution of assigned claims in accordance with legal statutes, policy provisions, and company guidelines to achieve positive results.
* Effectively and accurately identify, analyze, and bring to RESOLUTION of case issues by:

o Reviewing and understanding EOBs, their related terms pertaining to No Fault and Liens.

o Identifying insurance coverage eligibility through examination of claims documentation and relate records.

o Resolving issues by collaborating with other departments to have bills and/or records corrected to prepare submission packets.

o If needed, contacting patients, treating offices, and attorneys to resolve claims.

o Reviewing and submit declaratory actions from court in order to submit to arbitrating attorneys for legal filings.

* Consistently, reconcile account balances and verify payments to ensure proper payment applications on claims.
* Review cases to determine arbitration eligibility. Adjudicate the claim effectively if arbitration is eligible based on department process guidelines.

title: Medical Assistant/Front Desk
description:
Job Overview

We are seeking a skilled Front Desk Agent to join our healthcare team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for greeting patients and providing exceptional customer service while working in a fast-paced clinical environment. The Front Desk Agent will be the first point of contact for patients and visitors, and will play a critical role in ensuring a smooth and efficient patient experience.

Duties

- Manage patient registration and check-in procedures, ensuring all necessary information is collected and updated in our electronic medical record system.  
- Respond to patient inquiries and address any concerns or questions they may have.  
- Provide clear and concise instructions to patients regarding their appointments, tests, and treatment plans.  
- Coordinate with healthcare providers to schedule appointments and procedures.  
- Administer medications and injections as directed by healthcare providers.  
- Utilize medical terminology and anatomy knowledge to accurately document patient information.  
- Perform inpatient and outpatient admissions and discharges.  
- Manage emergency situations by following established protocols and communicating effectively with healthcare providers.  
- Maintain a clean and organized front desk area, ensuring all necessary supplies are stocked and available.  
- Perform other related duties as assigned.

Requirements

- High school diploma or equivalent required.  
- Experience working in a hospital, clinic, or healthcare setting.  
- Familiarity with electronic medical records and medical terminology.  
- Ability to administer medications and injections.  
- Knowledge of anatomy and emergency medicine procedures.  
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.  
- Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and adapt to changing priorities.  
- Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.  
- Certification in medical terminology is preferred.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $23.00 per hour

Application Question(s):

* You've been asked to take vitals for a patient.

Which vitals would you take?  
A. Blood pressure  
B. Respiratory rate  
C. Radial pulse  
D. Temperature  
E. Intake  
F. Output  
G. Weight  
H. Height

* Which vital sign is likely documented incorrectly?

A. Blood pressure: 80/118 mmHg  
B. Respiratory rate: 18 breaths per minute  
C. Oxygen saturation (SpO2): 95%  
D. Pulse rate: 80 bpm  
E. Body temperature: 97.9°F

* What would be an appropriate way to check their responsiveness?

A. Shake their shoulders and ask, "Are you okay?"  
B. Loudly ask if they need help, without touching them  
C. Perform a sternum rub while calling their name loudly  
D. Gently spray water on their face and observe their reaction

title: Manager, Analytics
description:
**Company Description**  

Publicis Media harnesses the power of modern media through global agency brands Publicis Collective, Publicis Health Media, Spark Foundry, Starcom and Zenith, as well as global accelerator PMX and integrated platform-based technologies including CJ, CitrusAd, Epsilon and Profitero. A key business solution of Publicis Groupe ([Euronext Paris FR0000130577, CAC 40]), Publicis Media’s digital-first, data-driven global solutions deliver client value and drive growth in a platform-powered world. It is present in over 100 countries with over 23,000 employees worldwide.

 **Job Description** **What does Analytics do?**


Working closely with both the Business Planning and Activation teams, Analytics designs the data strategy to tie our clients’ marketing to real-world business goals. We then mine that data to optimize campaigns and tell the stories that bring our clients closer to their marketing, helping them understand if they’re talking to the people they want, and if they’re doing it the right way.

 **What does a successful Manager look like?**

We’re don’t all look the same, and we don’t expect you to, either. But successful members of our team generally have a passion for emerging tech and media, bring a data-driven approach to decision-making, have a fresh perspective and share it in a positive way, don’t shy away from a challenge, and are always hungry to learn more.


Among Manager candidates, we generally look for prior experience in media analytics, especially digital media. You should already be used to representing your team to external clients, since Managers are often the face of our Analytics team. We hope you’re a numbers whiz and know how to bring data to life through a compelling story. We’re also hoping you have at least a year’s worth of experience managing junior-level staff members and have at least three years of prior professional experience.

 **What does an Analytics Manager do day-to-day?**


Our Managers work very closely with the Analysts and Senior Analysts to help them stay on track with day-to-day deliverables, but also build great stories. Managers also work closely with their Associate Directors to formulate a vision for their accounts, and then execute on that vision with their Analysts and Senior Analysts. As such, Managers are mentors, managers, project managers, and thought leaders, all at the same time.

 **Qualifications**  

* Minimum 3+ years of relevant experience
* Minimum 1 year of management experience of junior-level staff
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office (PPT, Excel, Word); Expert in complex Excel formulas
* Robust experience with at least one major third-party ad server with site-side tracking (like DoubleClick, Atlas, or Sizmek)
* Experience with a site analytics platform like Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
* Knowledge of at least one online advertising media channel: Search, Display Banners, Mobile, Email, Contextual, Social, and CRM
* Experience with Pacvue, Skai (Kenshoo), Marin, Criteo or other bid management software
* Deep knowledge of key retailers, their ecosystems, and go-to-market strategies
* Experience in Consumer Package Goods industry (CPG) preferred
* Strong critical thinking skills – able to perform client-critical analysis with limited oversight
* Ability to communicate complex ideas to both external and internal clients
* Demonstrate strong project management skills
* Bachelor’s Degree in a related field

**Desired Experience:**

* Preferred 4 - 6 years of relevant experience, agency experience is a plus
* Master’s Degree in a quantitative field and/or relevant coursework
* Experience with relational databases (SQL Server, MS Access, Oracle)
* Experience with ad verification tools like Integral Ad Science and MOAT
* Understanding and familiarity with advanced analytics practices (Descriptive Statistics, Linear Regression, Forecasting)
* Experience in at least one of the following areas: Programmatic (DMP, DSP), Cross Device Measurement, Attribution Modelling
* Experience with third-party research partners like Millward Brown, Nielsen, and comScore

  

**Additional Information**  

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Compensation Range: $105,000 - $110,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on the skills, qualifications, and experience of the applicant along with the requirements of the position, and the Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, the Company will offer medical coverage, dental, vision, disability, 401k, and paid time off. The Company anticipates the application deadline for this job posting will be 09/08/2024.

title: Dietitian-Level III-Oncology Center
description:
**About NYC Health + Hospitals**

Lincoln Medical and Mental Health Center is one of New York City’s premier acute care hospitals. Located in Downtown Bronx, Lincoln is a teaching hospital renowned for its Centers of Excellence, and a recognized industry leader in the implementation of state-of-the art medical technology and best practices. Our team of highly trained and caring medical professionals is dedicated to providing the highest quality health care that is safe, compassionate, culturally competent and patient-centered. Comprehensive services are offered in three major primary care areas: Medicine, Pediatrics, and Women’s Health in addition to more than eighty (80) specialty services. At Lincoln, the safety and comfort of our patients is our number one priority.

At NYC Health + Hospitals, our mission is to deliver high quality care health services, without exception. Every employee takes a person-centered approach that exemplifies the ICARE values (Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, and Excellence) through empathic communication and partnerships between all persons.

Visit us at www.nyc.gov/html/hhc/lincoln.

**Job Description**

**Purpose of Position:**

This class of positions encompasses work of varying degrees of difficulty and responsibility in the operation of a Dietary Department. There are four (4) Assignment Levels within this class of positions; all personnel perform related work. The following are typical assignments within this class of positions.

**General tasks and responsibilities will include:**

* Provides appropriate nutritional care for patients in various outpatient practices including but not limited to

Adult Medicine, Pediatrics, Geriatrics, Oncology, Women's Health Center, Immunology, Dialysis Center and group nutrition education classes. May relieve inpatient areas/units as assigned.

* Interviews patients for nutritional history. Completes timely documentation in patient's electronic medical record such as nutritional assessments, follow-up notes and patient goals.
* Provides nutritional counseling, diet instructions and food/drug interaction counseling. Recommends supplements as indicated and monitors patient's use.
* Interprets pertinent laboratory and other diagnostic data to determine appropriate care plan.
* Utilizes and develops as needed appropriate nutrition education materials (age specific, culturally sensitive, low health literacy, and condition specific).
* Plans nutrition/health programs, implements, and evaluates nutrition education in different settings.
* Participates in interdisciplinary rounding/discharge planning/meetings and other appropriate patient care meetings. Consults with physicians and other health care faculty members as necessary.
* Conducts rounds at meal time to observe patient food intake and provides them with nutrition information, which will enable them to make nutritionally balanced food choices; submits meal round reports in a timely manner.
* Teaches nutrition classes as needed to patients, employees, students and health care team members.
* Reports problems to immediate supervisor and recommends ways to improve nutritional services. Establishes rapport with all members of the health care team and within the department in order to assure good public relations and quality nutritional care to patients.
* Attends dietitians' meetings, nutrition committee meetings and weekly departmental huddles as scheduled. Participates in the development and implementation of quality assurance activities including Productivity Reports, as assigned. Completes accurate Productivity Reports at end of shift daily.
* Assists in orientation, training, supervision and evaluation of nutrition students, Dietitian I and 11.
* Maintains continuing education in nutrition, clinical dietetics, food service management and related areas as appropriate in order to update current knowledge and skills in the practice of dietetics and performance of assigned.

**Minimum Qualifications**

Qualification Requirements:

For appointment to Assignment Level I

1. Baccalaureate degree from an accredited college or university, with a major in Dietetics or Foods and Nutrition in a program approved by the American Dietetic Association (ADA); or,

2. Registration or eligibility for registration by the Commission on Dietetic Registration (CDR) as a Registered Dietitian or New York State Certification as a Dietitian-Nutritionist.

For appointment to Assignment Level II

1. Registration or eligibility for registration by the CDR as a Registered Dietitian or New York State Certification as a Dietitian-Nutritionist.

For appointment to Assignment Levels III and IV

1. Registration by the CDR as a Registered Dietitian or New York State Certification as a Dietitian-Nutritionist.

Special Note for Dietitians assigned to Post-Acute Care (Long-Term Care) facility:

Under the Medicare and Medicaid Programs, Reform of Requirements for Long-Term Care Facilities, as outlined in Section 483.60 of Title 42 of the Code of Federal Regulations all newly-hired Dietitians, Levels I-IV assigned to a Post-Acute Care (Long-Term Care) facility, are required to have New York State Certification, issued by the New York State Education Department (NYSED), as a Dietitian-Nutritionist at the time of hire. Dietitians, Levels I-IV hired prior to November 28, 2016, assigned to a Post-Acute Care (Long-Term Care).

**NYC Health and Hospitals offers a competitive benefits package that includes:**

* Comprehensive Health Benefits for employees hired to work 20+ hrs. per week
* Retirement Savings and Pension Plans
* Loan Forgiveness Programs for eligible employees
* Paid Holidays and Vacation in accordance with employees' Collectively bargained contracts
* College tuition discounts and professional development opportunities
* Multiple employee discounts programs

title: Japanese Beverage Specialist
description:
osition: Japanese Beverage Specialist - On Premise Market Development (NY/NJ)

Position Overview:

Works under a Team Leader as an important part of the Japanese Beverage Specialist Team, tasked with expanding the reach and market share of the MTC SAKE import portfolio in the NY/NJ area, with a specific focus on developing leads in on premise. Tasked with year over year sales growth in total revenue and gross profit, and are expected to grow total cases and PODs for the company's alcoholic beverages category, as well as to help promote company and brand recognition and support clients as an MTC SAKE sales representative.

The appropriate candidate will be passionate & knowledgeable about the alcoholic beverages industry and/or Japanese sake, shochu, craft beers & craft spirits. They will maintain a comprehensive catalog of knowledge on the company's brands, item details & market positioning, key market trends & competitor brands. Looking for an energetic and motivated self-starter, and an effective communicator who is fastidious with follow-up and mindful of the needs of their customers and coworkers.

Starting salary based on individual's experience & expertise, with opportunities for annual incentives & advancement. Full benefits for employee/dependents offered at NO additional cost, including Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, Life Insurance and industry education opportunities through Sake School of America. Various optional add-ons. Approximately 220 days of travel & market work outside of the office.

Job Responsibilities:

- Works to seeking out and develop new targets & business opportunities both independently & as directed through management.

- Serves as primary point of contact for all aspects of business with assigned accounts & regions.

- Plans & executes events and promotions to increase company beverage sales.

title: CASE MANAGER (DHS)
description:
Founded in 1981, **Diaspora Community Services (DCS)** is a Brooklyn-based multi-service and multi-cultural 501 (c) 3 nonprofit providing comprehensive supports to low income residents, immigrants, and the chronically ill. DCS serves some 10,000 annually through three programmatic sites in New York City. Staffed by seasoned professionals in the health and social service sectors and supported by a dedicated Board of Directors as diverse as the vibrant communities we serve, DCS provides robust programming that targets the most vulnerable of our communities.

DCS’s programs address the very root causes of the challenges our clients face, empowering low income families and individuals to overcome obstacles to their well-being and self-sufficiency. DCS continues to focus on the challenges and inequities that impact communities of color, women and the youth of our communities. Using an anti-racist, gender, sexual orientation affirming lens, DCS has focused on ensuring clients have access to much needed benefits, counseling, education, housing placement and referrals to many qualified organizational partners. DCS has implemented youth programs based on youth development principles of education, empowerment and focusing on the assets of our youth instead of deficits. We are known for our expertise on HIV prevention at the community based level.

Current program services include access to quality health services, supportive housing, youth education, and the social support services critical to meeting basic needs while focusing on impacting poverty. DCS meets each client where they are in terms of individual skills, finances, health and needs; providing one-on-one transformative support to help them succeed.

**Job Summary:**

**The Case Managers** must be bilingual Spanish with expertise, knowledge of public benefits, workforce development and experience working with immigrants, especially migrants and those that are undocumented. The Case Manager will conduct intakes, assessments, and service plans. They will coordinate related activities to support the goals, objectives and development of the program and individual resident. Escorts, case conference, individual and group counseling as well as educational workshops is part of the required job duties. Knowledge of DHS systems, policies and procedures, documentation systems and standards of compliance is a plus. Other duties as assigned

**Qualifications:**

Bachelors preferred with 3-5 years of case manager experience or High School with 5 years of case manager experience.

**Compensation:**

Compensation is competitive and commensurate with experience. Diaspora Community Services offers a comprehensive benefits package including full health, dental and vision insurance benefits, voluntary flexible spending plan, 403b retirement plan, and eligible to accrue 10 vacation days, 3 personal days, 8 sick days and up to 12 paid holidays.

***Diaspora Community Services does not discriminate on the basis of race, ethnicity, color, religion (creed), gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status, in any of its activities, hiring practices or operations.***

title: Luke's Lobster Shift Leader, Financial District
description:
**Full Job Description**

Luke’s Lobster is a Maine-inspired, fast-casual lobster shack known for its award-winning seafood rolls. Our seafood is traceable to its source, sustainably caught and processed by our own team to our own high standards.

**Role :** Shift Leader - NYC, FIDI

**Compensation & Benefits**

* Wage: $18/hr + SIGNIFICANT TIPS

*\\*\\*On average, Luke’s Teammates earn an additional* ***$14/hr*** *when you factor in tips!\\*\\**

* Company sponsored 401k Program with matching potential (after one year)
* Pre-Tax Commuter Benefits (based on location)
* Employee Discounts
* Health Insurance Program, including medical, dental and vision (for qualifying teammates)
* Free access to mental health resources and licensed counselors (for qualifying teammates)
* Opportunities for advancement in a growing companyDo you care about working for an ethical, environmentally-focused company? Do you thrive working in a supportive and collaborative environment that values and solicits open and honest communication? Then you will love working at Luke’s Lobster! We believe all boats rise when you put people, community, and the environment at the heart of all decision-making.

**Duties & Responsibilities**

We offer delicious, high-quality seafood that our guests love. To make that happen you’ll be-

* Preparing and serving a simple, seafood-centric menu (there’s no cooking but some minor food prep)
* Engaging in friendly guest interaction
* Taking orders and recommending products at the register
* Performing opening and closing duties, including cleaning and setting up for shifts
* Utilizing your exceptional attention to detail, safety, cleanliness and organization
* Communicating Luke's mission of serving sustainable, traceable seafood (We’re a certified B-Corp!)
* What does that mean? Check it out here: https://www.bcorporation.net/community/lukes-lobster

**Qualifications**

* Preparing and serving a simple, seafood-centric menu (there’s no cooking but some minor food prep)
* Engaged guest interaction and frequent table-touches
* Taking orders, recommending products, and creative merchandising at the register
* Opening and closing duties including cleaning (sweeping, mopping, light dishes, setting up for AM/PM shift)
* Exceptional attention to cleanliness and organization
* Communicating Luke's mission of serving sustainable, traceable seafood
* Opening and closing the shack as a key-holder
* Overseeing a small team of 2-3 during your shift a
* Cash handling, tip distribution

**The Luke's Lobster Story**

Luke’s Lobster was born out of the dream of Maine native and third-generation lobsterman, Luke Holden, to bring the quality lobster rolls of his youth to the big city. He and business partner, Ben Conniff, opened their first lobster shack in NYC’s East Village in October 2009. Now, almost 15 years later, Luke’s Lobster brings traceable, sustainable seafood to guests across the globe. We work directly with fishermen to hand pick the best seafood, bring it straight to our own seafood company in Saco, ME and then ship directly to our shacks, grocery partners, and consumers. From the dock to our guests, we’ve cut out the middleman. This means higher quality, better tasting seafood for you to enjoy and a fairer price for our fishermen. We know our fishermen, we know where and how they fish, and we work together to protect our oceans for tomorrow.

We are proud and passionate about the work environment we have fostered and are excited to see it continue to grow. We value diversity, creativity, transparency and open communication from all levels. Please visit www.lukeslobster.com for more inform

**Equal Opportunity Statement**

Luke's Lobster provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to any status, including but not limited to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Luke's Lobster complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training. Luke's Lobster expressly prohibits all forms of workplace harassment. Improper interference with the ability of Luke's Lobster employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge. Essential job functions include standing for sustained periods of time, lifting objects from lower to higher positions, ascending or descending stairs, and bending, crouching, and reaching to low and high places. Luke's Lobster is a participant of E-Verify.

* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid training

Shift:

* Evening shift

title: Program Coordinator (Dodge YMCA)
description:
Salary: $19.00 Hourly  


The YMCA of Greater New York is here for all New Yorkers — to empower youth, improve health, and strengthen community. Founded in 1852, today the Y serves a diverse population of more than half a million New Yorkers who learn, grow, and thrive through programs and services at our 24 branches. Community is the cornerstone of the Y. Together, we connect active, engaged New Yorkers to build stronger communities.  


To help fulfill our mission, we cultivate a culture of learning, leading, and collaboration to enhance community impact. Through our talented staff and “LEAP” career framework (Leadership, Empowerment, Accountability, Personal Growth), we are committed to a people-first approach that fosters trust, inclusion, growth, and development for all.  


The Dodge YMCA is seeking a Program Coordinator who, under the supervision of the Site Director, will be responsible for developing, implementing, delivering, supervising, and evaluating the programs at the Y Afterschool and Summer Day Camp programs, including Holiday Camps. The Program Coordinator will focus on program quality and delivery of services as well as training and development of the staff, including Activity Specialists and Program Aides.  


Key Responsibilities:  


Ensure the health, safety, and well-being of program participants by providing supervision of all activities.  


Promote an inclusive, welcoming, and respectful environment that embraces the diversity of all participants.  


Maintain accurate program documentation (participant files, data entry, DYCD Online, AS400, attendance, sign-in/out forms, behavior reports, incident reports, and accident reports, as appropriate).  


Support the Site Director and supervise Activity Specialists, Counselors, Advisors, and Volunteers in the implementation of the Y Programs, Summer Camp Programs, and CIT Programs.  


Work cooperatively with professional staff, teachers, and other program, housing, and school staff.  


Create and maintain a strength-based, youth-focused atmosphere that is consistent and sensitive to the needs of participants with learning, emotional, or behavioral differences.  


Create marketing flyers for program awareness and enrollment, update bulletin boards, and create a monthly newsletter.  


Serve as a positive role model for participants.  


Develop and maintain positive relationships with parents and guardians through regular communication about their child’s strengths and areas of growth.  


Work with the Program Site Director to secure and maintain all equipment or supplies needed.  


Understand and communicate the YMCA’s core values and the goals of the program to participants and caregivers.  


Actively participate in training sessions, designated department meetings, and special events (i.e., Healthy Kids Day, Open Houses).  


Adhere to all Department of Health, YMCA of Greater New York, and funder standards, expectations, and regulations.  


Desired Skills & Experience:  


High school diploma or equivalent required. Bachelor’s degree preferred.  


Minimum of two (2) years of hands-on experience working in youth programs.  


General knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint required.  


Knowledge of Access, Adobe PageMaker and Photoshop preferred.  


Must be available Monday - Friday from 1:00 pm - 6:00 pm.  


Benefits:  
The YMCA of Greater New York offers a variety of benefits to its staff members, including retirement benefits, medical, paid time off, free YMCA membership, and more! Benefit eligibility is determined by an individual’s employment status (i.e., full-time or part-time), tenure, and/or the number of hours scheduled to work. Click here for more information.  


How to Apply:  
If you would like to be a member of our dynamic team, please complete our online application and submit your résumé and a thoughtful cover letter that explains your interest in the role and our organization.  


If you are a current YMCA employee, please submit your application through the Internal Career Site in Cornerstone.  


Job Type: Part-time  


Pay: From $19.00 per hour  


Work Location: In person

description:
Summary of Position
* Direct oversight of the Regulatory Complaint functions, ensuring compliance with all regulatory, state and federal guidelines


for all product lines.

resolutions best support our internal processes and resources and are implemented in a timely fashion.

Principal Accountabilities

Departmental Operations:

* Monitor daily reports to ensure that all timeframes are met to maximize member and provider satisfaction
* Responsible for ensuring timely and accurate responses to all regulatory complaints

title: Provider Contract Manager
description:
Summary of Position
* Responsible for developing and executing network and contracting strategy with senior leadership.
* Identify and negotiate financially beneficial terms to support business and clinical initiatives to continually advance network


relationships and manage the medical trend.  

* Ensure that the competitive contractual engagements translate into competitive rates for customers, leading to increased


membership growth.  

* Direct programs to resolve root cause claims/operational issues; educate providers on EH policies, procedures & processes.



Principal Accountabilities
* Develop and lead quality relationships with providers.
* Accountable for significant hospital and physician network contract negotiations, including leadership and oversight of


the negotiation process, ensuring contracts are negotiated and maintained at optimum cost/benefit levels.  

* Lead ongoing contract maintenance and resolution of business issues associated with contract terms, including


financial settlements, provider reporting, etc.  

* Assess financial impact of contractual rates and recommend rate corridors.
* Lead contracting team to ensure complete understanding of current contractual terms and communicate issues that


may arise as the contract term is renewed.  

* Partner with operational areas such as UM, Claims, Medical Management, Quality and GAD to ensure compliance with


facility agreements. Assemble Joint Operating Committee and Joint Workgroup, including structure, processes,  

documentation and membership.  

* Develop and coordinate overall contracting and contract-specific strategies and recommendations; translate provider


strategies into tactical and accountable plans. Lead quarterly meetings with strategic provider partners to review  

performance and recommend initiatives to strengthen our partnerships.  

* In collaboration with key internal collaborators, establish a measurable plan to lead the development and


implementation of advanced and emerging provider network contract models and reimbursement methodologies with  

providers in the EmblemHealth network.  

* Maintain contracting calendars and/or a contract dashboard to ensure adherence to key contract dates/timelines


related to contract requirements, adjustment and/or renewals.  

* Contract with physicians and practitioners for all PPO and HMO lines of business including government programs.
* Oversee contracting of all pathologists, anesthesiologist, radiologist and ER physician groups.
* Develop processes and practices to ensure that contracts and supporting documentation are compliant with legal and


regulatory requirements, completed within leadership determined timelines and that contract terms are accurately  

articulated for implementation purposes.  

* Obtain documentation for credentialing; collect data pertaining to NY State Health Provider Network (PNDS) reporting.
* Lead, coach, train, develop, and manage staff to ensure corporate and department goals and objectives are met.
* Special projects as assigned.
* Perform other related tasks as directed, assigned, or required.


Education, Training, Licenses, Certifications
* BS in Business Administration, Health Care Administration, Finance or related; Master’s preferred.



Relevant Work Experience, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
* 10 – 12+ years of relevant, professional work experience. (R)
* 5 – 8+ years of experience with managed care, health administration or health education and contracting, provider and/or


vendor management. (R)  

* Expert level understanding of contract terms, SLAs, metrics, etc. (R)
* Understanding of applicable regulations related to healthcare. (R)
* Excellent communication skills (verbal, written, presentation, interpersonal, negotiations). (R)
* Proficient with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, etc.). (R)
* Prioritizing and organizing skills; outstanding attention to detail. (R)
* Proven track record of successfully managing multiple tasks/projects with conflicting priorities/deadlines. (R)

extremely tight deadlines. Ensure accuracy and compliance within the constraints of extremely quick turnaround times.  

* Perform end-to-end G&A processing; consistently operate in a fast-paced high-pressure environment.
* Monitor all aspects of the G&A process; ensure that members have appropriate access to care.
* Due to regulatory requirements and turn-around times of the Expedited Appeal unit, the Specialists are required to work


weekends and holidays as the organization must maintain expedited appeal coverage 7 days a week, 365 days a year.

Principal Accountabilities
* Independently perform triage function: review and evaluate appeal requests; identify and classify member and


provider appeals. Using internal systems, determine eligibility, benefits, and prior activity related to the claims,  

payment, or service in question.  

* Provide verbal and written member and provider correspondence as needed for authorized representative or needed


clinical information.  

* Conduct thorough investigations of all member and provider correspondence by analyzing all the issues presented and


obtaining responses and information from internal and external entities. Validate the responses to ensure they  

address the issues and are supported by any contract stipulations, regulations, etc., as applicable.  

* Make critical decisions regarding research and investigation to appropriately resolve all inquiries; prepare cases for


medical and administrative review detailing the findings of their investigation for consideration in the Plan’s  

determination; make recommendations on administrative decisions by preparing detailed case summaries and  

reviewing all applicable benefit and contract materials; present findings and recommendations to appropriate parties  

for sign-off.  

* Serve as liaison with EmblemHealth departments, delegated entities, medical groups, and network physicians to


ensure timely authorization effectuation and resolution of cases.  

* Perform necessary follow-up with responsible departments and delegated entities to ensure compliance.
* Monitor hourly and daily pending reports and personal worklists, ensuring adherence to CMS, NCQA, DOH, NYS,


Connecticut and Massachusetts regulatory requirements, as well as operational SLAs and department performance  

standards, thereby ensuring members’ access to care.  

* Independently prepare well written, customized responses to all correspondence that appropriately and completely


address the complainant’s issue(s) and are structurally accurate. Responsible for ensuring responses are completed  

within the applicable regulatory timeframe.  

* Complete submission of case files and responses to entities such as DFS, DOH, AG and Maximus; ensure timely and


appropriate response submissions.  

* Document final resolutions along with all required data to facilitate accurate reporting, tracking, and trending.
* Identify workflow improvements and work with the team to recommend and implement change(s).
* Provide recommendations to management regarding issue resolution, root cause analysis and best practices.
* Serve as a point of escalation for problems, providing guidance and expertise to team members as well as helping to


identify and address core business requirements.  

* May train, guide, and mentor new G&A Specialists.
* Serve as a coach and mentor to the associates providing support and guidance in complex situations.
* Maintain acceptable attendance standard with minimal unscheduled PTO.
* Exceed median production and compliance standards for both case resolution and data requirements.
* Perform other duties as directed, assigned, or required.


Education, Training, Licenses, Certifications
* Bachelors’ degree.



Relevant Work Experience, Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
* 3 – 5+ years of related experience, preferably in the health industry and/or area of compliance. (R)
* Additional related experience/specialized training may be considered in lieu of degree requirements. (R)
* Extensive knowledge and experience in claims, enrollment, benefits, and member contracts. (R)
* Ability to mentor specialists and to provide assistance on complex cases. (R)
* Must be well versed in all aspects of the complaint, grievance and appeal process and be able to process all types of


correspondence handled by Grievance and Appeals. (R)  

* Proficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Teams, SharePoint, etc.). (R)
* Excellent product knowledge. (R)

* Ability to work under pressure and deliver complete, accurate, and timely results. (R)

title: Cardiovascular Tech
description:
St. Francis Hospital is dedicated to providing a supportive environment, committed to the highest standards of patient care, where health care professionals can develop their expertise and strengthen their credentials.

Duties of Cardiovascular Tech

* Assists during emergency resuscitation.
* Responsible for reviewing the accuracy of printed records prior to placing in medical record and evaluate accuracy of data.
* Performs post processing of acquired images and assures secure storage and retrieval of images.
* Set up sterile equipment for diagnostic and therapeutic procedures demonstrating aseptic technique.
* Scrub during diagnostic and interventional procedures on the adult patient and assist as needed.
* Performs sheath removal and achieves hemostasis effectively.
* Assist with patient comfort and wellbeing before, during, and immediately following the procedure. These duties will address the physical, psychosocial, and spiritual needs of the patient.
* Through sampling and recording, provide data from which precise anatomic and physiologic diagnosis may be established.
* In coordination with RN, setup non-invasive monitoring -- ECG, blood pressure cuff, and pulse oximetry.
* Operates intravascular ultrasound (IVUS) and other catheter based imaging modalities.
* Oversees digital imaging equipment to optimally define anatomy.
* Participates in team huddle, time-out, and all aspects of procedure as suggested for patient safety.
* In coordination with RN, performs/reviews baseline patient hemodynamic data and evaluates patient response to diagnostic or interventional maneuvers during procedures.
* Assists as scrub tech during interventional procedures.
* Functions as a scrub person during operative and other invasive procedures by assembling supplies and equipment and preparing and organizing sterile supplies and instruments for the procedure.
* Is knowledgeable of all equipment and supplies required for each case type and where they can be obtained.
* Demonstrates technical knowledge of procedures.
* Checks physician preference for equipment required prior to each procedure.
* Communicates information with RN to ensure smooth progress of case. Observes and reports, to a nurse, changes in the patient’s condition.
* Preps access site as ordered by physician pre-procedure
* Collects necessary equipment prior to scrubbing/approaching bed side.
* Actively works to improve performance by seeking and acting on feedback from others.
* Demonstrates knowledge of patient safety standards and follows all hospital policies and procedures pertaining to patient safety.

This range serves as a good faith estimate and actual pay will encompass a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, and experience and position location. The salary range or rate listed does not include any bonuses/incentive, differential pay or other forms of compensation that may be applicable to this job and it does not include the value of benefits.

At Catholic Health, we believe in a people-first approach. In addition to the estimated base pay provided, Catholic Health offers generous benefits packages, generous tuition assistance, a defined benefit pension plan, and a culture that supports professional and educational growth.

title: Paralegal (Entry Level)
company: Pasternack Tilker Ziegler Walsh Stanton & Romano LLP
description:
For over 80 years, Pasternack Tilker Ziegler Walsh Stanton and Romano, LLP. has been defending the rights of New Yorkers. Our attorneys help hard-working people get the compensation they rightfully deserve. With 12 offices throughout the five boroughs, Long Island and Upstate New York, our firm serves clients in need of legal representation for Worker’s Compensation, Social Security Disability, Civil Service Disability Pensions, and Personal Injury claims.

We are currently seeking an experienced Paralegal to join our highly productive Social Security Disability practice. This position involves daily and constant work helping attorneys keep their cases well-organized and moving. The ideal candidate will be highly motivated, have a high standard of ethics and strong communication skills.

Duties/Responsibilities:

· Conducting claimant interviews for new cases

· Open new files, gather and analyze intake information and relevant documents.

· Heavy call volume which includes extensive contact with clients, attorneys, insurance adjusters, and medical providers, In person client appointments

· Case Management and File Reviews for preparation of upcoming hearings and settlements

· Read, interpret, and follow up on medical reports.

· Contact insurance carriers for payments and medical treatment issues.

· Performs other related duties as assigned.

Required Skills/Abilities:

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills; effectively shows empathy to claimants who are dealing with difficult circumstances.

· Upbeat with a can-do attitude; must be able to work independently and have a desire to assume significant responsibility.

· Understanding of legal language and principles, and other related matters.

· Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.

· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

· Excellent time management skills with a proven ability multitask and meet deadlines.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment.

· Ability to maintain confidentiality, and to exercise discretion and good judgment.

· Proficient with Microsoft Office Outlook, Excel, and Word.

· Fluent in Spanish is a plus.

As part of a performance-based culture, you will work alongside a team of engaged like-minded compassionate professionals. Essentially, you would support a collegian team of legal experts, dedicated to fighting hard and winning big for our clients.

If you strive for excellence and are ready to hit the ground running with one of NYC’s top-rated law firms, submit a cover letter and your resume for immediate consideration.

title: Driver and Warehouse Assistant
description:
**Driver/Warehouse Assistant**

**Valley Stream, NY**

**Full time, M-F**

**TSA Certification Required**

Cryoport, Inc. is redefining temperature controlled supply chain support for the life sciences industry by continually broadening its platform of solutions, serving the biopharma, reproductive medicine and animal health markets.

***Bluebird Express provides quality Domestic and International transportation services. We are committed to the highest level of communication, enhancing your ability to manage your business.***

***Our dynamic approach to quality customer service instills confidence that your shipment is in good hands.***

Bluebird Express, a CRYOPDP company, is seeking a **Driver/Warehouse Assistant** for its Valley Stream, New York facility.

The main function of this role will be the pickup and delivery of temperature-controlled shipments between the Bluebird Express warehouse, major airports and client locations. When needed, this role will fulfill warehouse duties as well.

Prior experience in the handling of cold chain, temperature-controlled biological materials is not required but a plus. This role reports directly to the Operations Manager.

**Primary responsibilities (include but are not limited to):**

* Stock control including periodic cycle counts of product and packaging material
* Preparing & conditioning TCP incl. handling of phase change materials
* Recording and data entering all information regarding temp-controlled packaging
* Physical picking and packing of materials. Load, unload, prepare, inspect, and operate a delivery vehicle
* Assist with preparing and charging vapor shipping tanks (dry shippers) with liquid nitrogen according to charging and safety procedures
* Communicate directly with clients during delivery and pick-up assignments
* Comply with all TSA Regulations such as planned route and locking vehicle at all times
* Complete driver logs and reports as assigned
* Receive empty dry shippers, clean, sanitize, and ready for next use
* Comply with quality & safety guidelines for handling materials and operating equipment
* Deliver a wide variety of items to different addresses through different routes
* Follow routes and schedule
* Ask for feedback on provided services and resolve clients complaints
* Follow DOT regulations and safety standards
* Ensure all traffic laws are observed
* Ensure safety precautions are implemented and maintained during transit and while in the warehouse
* Perform other duties as assigned

**Work schedule**

Monday through Friday, 8:30 - 5 PM plus occasional out-of-hours and weekend coverage as needed.

**Required Skills**

***Profile (experience/education)***

* High school Diploma or equivalent
* Minimum 1 yrs proven Delivery driver experience
* Physical ability to lift up to 80 lbs
* English language proficient

**Specific Experience & Knowledge Required**

* Safety culture and quality-oriented
* Ability to operate forklifts and tractors in all weather and traffic conditions
* Familiar with airline documentation and TSA Regulations
* Experience with major airlines and their processes when tendering and recovering shipments
* Experience with TSA Security measures as per TSA Security Training offerings
* Able to learn and operate data logger devices, handheld scanners, and other power equipment as directed
* Working knowledge in cold chain management/strong in cold chain facilities (willing to train).

**Interpersonal skills ("Essential")**

* Rigorous/strong attention to detail
* Highly organized and prioritization skills
* Communicate with clarity and impact
* Strong customer service orientation with a high sense of urgency
* Collaborative
* Team player
* Flexible and adaptable

**COMPENSATION:** $26.44 hr.

**Bluebird Express/CRYOPDP is an equal opportunity employer offering a competitive salary and the opportunity to contribute to a highly successful and growing global healthcare business. Benefits include health, dental, vision, life, short/long term disability insurances, 401K with match and stock equity (NASDAQ:CYRX).**

**To learn more about our companies, please visit https://bluexps.com/ and www.cryopdp.com.**
