description:
Job Description: Entry Level Pastry Chef Assistant

Position Overview:

We are seeking a passionate Pastry Chef Assistant to join our dynamic kitchen team. The ideal candidate will have a passion for pastry arts, a strong work ethic, and a desire to learn and grow in a professional kitchen environment. This role offers an excellent opportunity to work alongside experienced pastry chefs in a high energy and fun kitchen environment.

Preparation of Ingredients: Assist in measuring and preparing ingredients according to recipes and specifications.

Baking and Pastry Production: Support pastry chefs in baking cakes, pastries, breads, and other desserts.

Decorating and Plating: Assist in decorating pastries and desserts with precision and attention to detail.

Cleaning and Sanitation: Ensure cleanliness and organization of workstations, equipment, and tools.

Adherence to Safety Standards: Follow all health and safety regulations and guidelines to maintain a safe working environment.

Proven experience (e.g., culinary school internship, apprenticeship) as a pastry assistant or in a similar role in a professional kitchen is preferred.

Basic knowledge of baking techniques, methods, and equipment.

Ability to follow recipes and instructions accurately.

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.

Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced team environment.

Flexibility to work mornings, evenings, weekends, and holidays as needed.

Knowledge of food safety and sanitation regulations.

title: Route Sales Account Manager
description:
At Big Geyser Inc., we are New York’s largest non-alcoholic family-owned beverage distributor. If you are looking to join a collaborative team that is rapidly expanding and promotes career development, Big Geyser is where you belong!

We offer competitive compensation and a comprehensive benefits package which includes **Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, 401(k) + Generous Match, Retirement Savings, Paid Vacation**, **Paid Sick Time**, **Paid Family Leave** and much more.

**About the Position**

This sales position directs the overall brand-building activities within the assigned territory to maximize product sales, distribution, and profitability. Candidates will help develop incremental sales, reorders, and new product introduction into existing accounts as well as new accounts. They will also support proper shelf management techniques and introduce brand marketing initiatives, using all available resources to build strong, long-lasting relationships. This position reports to a Zone Manager.

***Compensation: 100% COMMISSION***

**Position Overview**

* Build and strengthen customer relationships to achieve long term partnerships.
* Educate key decision makers about our brands.
* Effectively communicate the full range of available products and services we offer.
* Help customers manage their Big Geyser inventory.
* Influence account leaders to achieve sales volume and margin targets.
* Ensure customers utilize current promotions and marketing tools.
* Execute all display programs to drive incremental volume on chain promotions.
* Execute trade merchandising standards in retail accounts.
* Merchandise and maintain company refrigeration equipment and racks to ensure compliance.
* Conduct field audits and report any opportunities or issues.
* Rotate stock and merchandiser during account visits.
* Plan sales targets.
* Act as team leaders, coordinating internal resources to ensure that customers receive the highest standard of service.
* Follow the Big Geyser core brand strategy by using an awareness of the top-selling SKUs for each brand and maintaining proper shelf management for all authorized items.

**What we are looking for in the ideal candidate**

* Knowledge of the beverage and food industry with a deep desire to outwork and outperform the competition.
* Conduct yourself in a positive, professional manner.
* Have a clean, professional appearance and be proud to wear brand-identified apparel.
* Strong verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills.
* Bilingual is a plus, but not required.
* Strong work ethic and decision-making skills.
* Flexibility to work extended hours, including weekends, if required to satisfy the needs of a customer.
* Must possess strong organizational skills and follow-up procedures.
* Willingness to embrace our company's philosophy by remaining: Positive, Aggressive, and Competitive with a Hard-Hitting Attitude while possessing strong Awareness and Accountability for relentless customer service.

title: Home Health Aide (HHA)/PCA
description:
ProLife Home Care is hiring Home Health Aide.

Responsibilities:  
- Provide home care services to elderly individuals or individuals with developmental disabilities, memory care needs, blind or other medical conditions.  
- Assist with activities of daily living, such as bathing, dressing, and grooming.  
- Administer medication and assist with medical documentation as required.  
- Perform specialized medical tasks as needed.  
- Prepare meals and assist with meal planning and nutrition.  
- Maintain a clean and safe living environment for clients.  
- Provide companionship and emotional support to clients.  
- Follow all HIPAA regulations and maintain client confidentiality.

Skills:  
- Previous experience working with individuals with Alzheimer's or memory care needs is preferred.  
- Strong communication skills and the ability to interact effectively with clients, families, and healthcare professionals.  
- Compassionate and patient demeanor when working with clients who may have physical or cognitive limitations.  
- Ability to follow instructions and work independently while adhering to care plans.  
- Knowledge of basic medical procedures and ability to provide basic first aid if necessary.

Please note that this position may require occasional travel to healthcare facilities for client appointments or consultations.

If you are passionate about providing quality home care services and making a positive impact on the lives of others, we encourage you to apply.

Summary  
As a Home Health Aide (HHA), you will be an essential part of providing compassionate care and support to individuals in their homes. With core skills in home & community care, patient care, and senior care, you will assist with activities of daily living, medication administration, and care plans. Your premium skills in patient observation, Alzheimer's care, and first aid will enable you to provide specialized care for individuals with memory care needs. Additionally, your relevant skills in cleaning, meal preparation, and medical documentation will ensure a safe and comfortable environment for those under your care. Join our team and make a meaningful impact on the lives of our clients.

title: Registered Nurse (RN)
description:
**Comunilife** is looking for a **Registered Nurse** to join their **Medical Respite Program** in Harlem. In collaboration with the Program team, the Registered Nurse (RN) conducts mental and physical health assessments, plans, develops, coordinates and provides treatment and rehabilitation, as well as professional support, and makes referrals to community resources, including community physicians and coordinates consultations from other health professionals. The RN is responsible for the management and administration of medication within their scope of practice and in consultation with the attending physician. ***We offer a very competitive salary commensurate with experience and a comprehensive benefit package including 90% employer paid health insurance and a pension plan. The salary range for this position is up to $100,000 a year.***

***Schedule:***

**Tues.-Sat. 9am-5pm**

**Responsibilities and Duties**

* Responsible for conducting psychiatric assessments; assessing physical health needs; making appropriate referrals to community physicians; providing management and administration of medication in conjunction with the psychiatrist; providing a range of treatment, rehabilitation, and supportive services.
* Provides comprehensive primary health care, including but not limited to, case finding, health screening, health promotion, physical and psychosocial assessment, case management, and overall management of medications.
* Ensure and maintain principles, and procedures that are in agreement with a Nursing licensure, Program guidelines, and the Department of Mental Health and Office of Mental Health regulations.
* Develop, maintain, and revise written plans of care and general health care records.
* Engage new clients in the continuum of care through outreach.
* Collaborate with other health care providers and make appropriate referrals.
* Serve as client advocate specifically in accessing the health care system.
* Provide communication to team members and participate in community and apartment visits to clients.
* Coordinate services with other community mental health services such as, inpatient, outpatient, emergency, or day treatment. Assist in the development of a program that closes gaps in the continuum of services.
* Affirm that all record keeping activities, including but not limited to, databases, daily logs, progress notes, and client charts are appropriately maintained and current.
* Assist in the training of team members in the range of health promotion and illness prevention, treatment, rehabilitation, and support services available.
* Serve as a health care resource to clients and extended families. In both self and group processes.
* Assist in the preparation of any and all clinical correspondence relative to the activities of the
* Team as requested by the City, State, or Federal funding sources.

**Job Qualifications**

**Requirements:**

* Must be a graduate of an Accredited School for Nursing with NYSED license.
* Certification in geriatric nursing, preferred.
* Previous experience in primary and behavioral health intake assessment
* 5+ experience working with older adults with serious mental illness preferred.
* Excellent organizational and communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel, plus proficient in health related computer applications.
* Bilingual/bi-cultural a plus.

Comunilife is an EEO employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Hotel Shuttle Driver
description:
**About us**

We are professional, fun and supportive.

Our work environment includes:

* Growth opportunities
* Lively atmosphere
* Company perks
* On-the-job training
* Safe work environment
* International workforce
* Free parking

**Hotel Shuttle Driver**

The Hyatt Place and Renaissance Flushing Hotels have long been known for going beyond simple accommodations to create rewarding experiences for their guests. Through efficient operations and attentive service, both hotels approach the hotel stay as an opportunity to inspire and discover.

At Meyer Jabara Hotels, we believe our guests select us because of our caring and attentive associates who are focused on providing efficient service and meaningful experiences. Our associates work in an environment that demands exceptional performance and offers great rewards. Whether it's career opportunities, job enrichment, or a supportive work environment; if you are ready for this challenge, then we are ready for you.

As an extension of our arrival experience, Airport Shuttle Service contributes to both hotel's commitment to high-quality guest service and teamwork and our shuttle personnel must be the kind of associates who appreciate high standards of excellence.

**Shuttle Driver Job Description**

We are seeking a reliable and customer-focused individual to join our team as a Hotel Airport Shuttle Driver. The primary responsibility of this position is to transport hotel guests to and from the airport in a safe and timely manner, ensuring exceptional service standards are maintained throughout the journey. The ideal candidate will possess excellent communication skills, a professional demeanor, and a valid driver's license.

**Below is a list of Shuttle Driver expectations:**

® Greet and transport guests to our downtown Flushing hotel locations

® Open doors and assist guests/visitors entering and leaving the shuttle vehicles and hotel properties

® Inform guests of property amenities, services, and hours of operation, and local areas of interest and activities.

® Identify and explain room features to guests (e.g., use of room key, ice and vending areas, in-room safe and valet laundry services).

® When available, transport guest luggage to and from guest rooms and/or designated bell area.

® Assist with luggage storage and retrieval when available

® Assist guests/visitors in and out of vehicles, including assisting guests with loading/unloading luggage.

® Supply guests with directions

® Adhere to all traffic laws and safety regulations while driving the shuttle

® Arrange transportation (e.g., taxi cab, shuttle bus) for guests/visitors, and record advance transportation requests as needed

® Communicate parking procedures to guests/visitors

® Welcome and acknowledge all guests according to company standards

® Speak with others using clear and professional language, and answer telephones using appropriate etiquette

® Maintain awareness of undesirable persons on property premises

® Perform other reasonable job duties as requested by Supervisors

® Greet every guest with a smile

® Use guests’ names at every opportunity

® Thank the guest and invite them back

® Provide refreshments in all shuttle vehicles

® Maintain clean and organized vehicles in good repair

**Additional Responsibilities and Job Functions: include, but are not limited to, the following:**

® Act with integrity, honesty and knowledge that promote the culture, values and philosophy of the Hyatt Place and Renaissance Flushing. Displays dignity and respect for others at all times.

® When available, assist guests with check-in and check-out processes (verifying registration, address and credit information, balancing bank, posting charges).

® When available, go above and beyond to provide assistance, i.e., assist with luggage, coffee, directions, wake up calls, future reservations, etc.

® Courteously and efficiently provide information to guests and visitor inquiries; coordinate all guest requests for special arrangement of services; inform guests of hotel services, features and room amenities.

® Assist guests with directions in a friendly, professional, and timely manner. Use suggestive selling techniques. Maintain a clean, organized vehicle for guests.

® Follow Hyatt Place and Renaissance Flushing operational policies and procedures, including those for cash and credit card handling, safety and security and all other policies, procedures and standards to ensure we can consistently exceed the guests’ expectations.

*The statements in this position description are intended to describe the essential nature and level of work being performed. They are not intended to be ALL responsibilities or qualifications of the job*

title: Production Assistant
description:
**About Conquest Sport Group** 

Conquest Sport Group is a leading manufacturer of outdoor sporting goods and accessories. Over 3 years of growth and expansion, CSG has acquired and licensed dozens of top brands, including globally recognized properties like Hurley, Brookstone, Justice, Limited Too & Canada Weather Gear.

Our product line includes beach towels, body boards, skateboards, scooters, hydration bottles & carriers, helmets, hammocks, pool inflatables, kayaks, swim goggles & snorkels, backpacks, camping gear, throw blankets and much more. CSG products can be found around the world and in virtually every retailer in the United States. CSG has also spearheaded hardware projects for Fortune 500 companies, managing the manufacturing process from concept to product. We may have even had a hand in designing the product you are using right now!

Privately owned and managed, CSG is focused on bringing innovation to the products that people use every day as well as identifying upcoming trends in the outdoor sporting goods space.

**Production Assistant** 

We are currently seeking a competent Production Assistant to support all aspects of product sourcing and development. The ideal candidate should be energetic, committed, and hungry to tackle multiple tasks at once within a fast-paced professional environment. The primary aim of the person in this position must be to ensure production takes place smoothly and problem-free.

If you are a restless and tenacious individual who can multitask, solve problems and take charge of tasks proactively, you’ll quickly become invaluable in this role!

* Help prepare costing sheets from overseas factories.
* Respond on a daily basis to emails from factories with respect to costing and development.
* Review all emails and costings with the department head to ensure quick daily actions.
* Follow up on samples and material correspondence being sent to and from factories.
* Keep an organized and up-to-date data sheet of all products currently being worked on.
* Assist in office work related to samples and products.
* Undertake errands as assigned.

**Ideal Qualifications and Skills:** 

* High school diploma required (further education preferred).
* Relevant training (e.g. production courses, etc.) is a huge plus.
* Proven prior experience as a production assistant or a passion for and interest in the industry.
* Knowledge of common terminology preferred.
* Fluency in Chinese is a huge plus.
* Computer/tech-savvy.
* Exceptional organizational skills.
* Excellent multitasker.
* Resourceful and creative problem-solver.
* Team player with excellent communication skills in both verbal and written forms.
* Physically strong (able to lift heavy objects on occasion) and possessing great stamina.

title: Associate Director, Content
description:
**Company Description** **Who is Starcom:**


With a history that dates back over 80 years, Starcom is a global communications planning and media leader. We are an agency still grounded in our founding principle that people are at center of all we do. Each day, we apply this belief to harness the transformative power of data and technology to inspire and move people and business forward. With more than 7,000 employees in over 100 offices around the world, Starcom partners with the world's leading marketers and brands, including Bank of America, Best Buy, Kellogg Company, McDonald's, Novartis, Samsung, Visa and more.

 **Job Description** **What You'll Do:**


As the Associate Director of Content you will create synergy amongst internal teams, external partners, and client stakeholders to carryout best-in-class, cutting-edge branded content programs. Furthermore, you will utilize your knowledge of content development, content strategy, and the advertisement/vendor landscape to build and strengthen top tier content partnerships and leverage the best investment options possible.


Must haves include a proven track record of building and maintaining strong relationships amongst internal and external partners. The ideal candidate will have in-depth experience within digital media and will be able to bring a strong, creative point-of-view to the table as it relates to creating campaigns that resonate with the target audience.


This is part of a creative, collaborative team that encourages out-of-the-box thinking, innovation and excellence.

**Responsibilities:**

* Partner with creatives during idea generation to identify potential for content in today's landscape through the lens of the consumer
* Work with Experience Planners to extend creative ideas through additional content leveraging JBP and preferred partnerships
* Establish content best practice in service of increasing advertising effectiveness
* Work with the Experience Planner and Brand Strategist, identify the role of content at a platform, target or partner level within the Experience Plan
* Work directly with the lead creatives, ensuring the execution will drive effectiveness based on consumer behavior and best practice within the channel (aka the creative translator)
* In partnership with Investment team, recommend how much content an experience plan can support given budget and reach sufficiency goals
* In partnership with Production, recommend what needs to be captured on the shoot, where to source it from, and ensure each execution is fit for purpose
* Work with Influencers or Media Publishers to produce branded content
* Participate in the development, execution, stewardship/project management, and reporting of campaign plans (social + digital + content)
* Understands all phases of the clients' marketing objectives and provides media recommendations to deliver against these objectives
* Participate in ideation sessions and brief partners on what is required of them to fulfill brand objectives in the content space.
* Demonstrates initiative by researching and identifying valuable information/insights to improve media product
* Work closely with partner agencies and brand team to ensure content programs are in line with overarching strategies.
* Project manage programs from proposal stage through end date including; concept development, asset negotiation, asset production and brand approval, reporting and optimizations
* Participate in negotiations which includes, but is not limited to, evaluating RFP's, spending trends, rate contracts, and program details across social, digital, mobile, and integrated programs
* Attend vendor meetings to stay on top of marketplace and cultivate relationships within the vendor community
* Understands all proprietary research tools/processes and applies learnings during planning process
* Ability to compile and analyze reporting to determine performance insights and application to future campaigns
* Management, mentorship, and training of team

  

**Qualifications** **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's Degree preferred, ideally in Marketing, Communications, Advertising or a related field
* 5+ years of directly related experience
* Previous experience with digital media and content strategy
* Strong quantitative and analytical skills with the ability to detect and translate a story behind numbers/data
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills; demonstrated ability to translate and present complicated ideas in a simple, and easy to understand yet inspirational /creative style
* Willingness to learn and create solutions that challenge the status quo
* Exceptional critical thinking and problem solving abilities with the ability to think unconventionally in proposing solutions
* Negotiation and influence skills – steeped in required industry, brand, and competitive knowledge
* A proven ability to multi-task and manage multiple projects effectively and work well under pressure to deliver high quality work within tight deadlines

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
HIRING ASAP (no H1Bs sorry)!

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior .NET Full Stack Developer Consultant to join our team. This is a 1099 contract position without benefits. The contract will last at least 12 months with opportunity to extend second year. or conversion to fulltime. The ideal candidate will be proficient in a variety of programming languages and technologies, with a strong focus on software development and application development. This role will be responsible for designing, building, and maintaining our company's web applications, ensuring they are efficient, scalable, and meet the highest standards of quality. You must have architect experience.

\\*\\*Duties\\*\\*

- Design and develop high-quality, scalable, and maintainable web applications using Ruby on Rails.

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and develop technical solutions.

- Develop and implement new features and functionality, as well as improve existing ones.

- Write clean, readable, and well-documented code, following best practices and adhering to our coding standards.

- Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues and bugs in a timely and efficient manner.

- Work closely with our DevOps team to ensure seamless deployment and maintenance of applications.

- Implement and maintain database structures using SQL, Oracle and RBAC.

- Use Agile methodologies to plan, track, and deliver projects on time.

- Stay up-to-date with the latest technologies and trends in software development, and apply this knowledge to improve our applications and processes.

- Participate in code reviews and contribute to the improvement of the codebase.

- Work in an Azure-based environment, utilizing cloud technologies to develop scalable and secure applications.

\\*\\*Experience\\*\\*

- A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

- At least 5 years of experience in full-stack development, with a focus on application development.

- Proficiency in Ruby on Rails, JavaScript, and SQL.

- Strong understanding of Agile methodologies and software development principles.

- Experience with RBAC and Azure, Oracle Cloud is plus.

- Experience with C++ and software development.

- Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.

- Excellent communication and teamwork skills.

- Experience with code reviews and contributing to open-source projects.

We offer a competitive salary and a dynamic work environment that fosters innovation, creativity, and growth. If you are passionate about software development and are looking for a challenging and rewarding role, we encourage you to apply for this position.

title: Bilingual Case Manager
description:

These programs provide permanent supportive housing and case management services for adults living with HIV/AIDS and chronic medical conditions as well as Young Adults (18-24) aging out of foster care. ***The positions offer a salary range of $42,000-$45,000, with a generous benefit package including health insurance, dental, vision, dependent care, paid time off, 401(k), tuition assistance program and more. There are available positions in the Bronx, Queens and Brooklyn.***

title: Compliance Investigation Manager
description:
**Title:** **Compliance Investigation Manager**
===============================================

Title: Compliance Investigation Manager


Location: Midtown


Org Unit: The Office of Compliance


Work Days: Monday - Friday


Weekly Hours: 35.00


Exemption Status: Exempt


Salary Range: $108,900.00 - $126,500.00


* As required under NYC Human Rights Law Int 1208-2018 - Salary range for this role when Hired for NYC Offices


**Position Summary**
--------------------



The Compliance Investigator at Weill Cornell Medicine plays a critical role in ensuring adherence to regulatory standards and institutional policies by conducting comprehensive investigations into compliance and patient-related complaints reported to the Compliance Office. This position focuses on identifying root causes, mitigating risks, drafting policies, and supporting incident response efforts to prevent future issues, thereby enhancing the overall effectiveness of the Weill Cornell Medicine Compliance Program.


**Job Responsibilities**
------------------------


* Independently and collaboratively (as needed) conduct investigations to determine the root causes of complaints and inquiries, while maintaining confidentiality to protect the integrity of the process.
* Work closely with other departments (e.g., Legal, HR, IT, RM) to ensure a coordinated approach to compliance and investigations.
* Perform timely and appropriate interviews and meetings in response to complaints and inquiries. Escalate urgent issues to the Executive Director and Chief Compliance and Privacy Officer immediately.
* Collaborate with external regulatory bodies, auditors, and other organizations as needed to support investigations and compliance efforts.
* Prepare accurate, complete, and factual documentation to support investigation findings.
* Author clear and concise investigative reports that can withstand regulatory scrutiny and provide sufficient detail to support findings and corrective actions.
* Maintain organized and complete investigative notes and files within the Compliance Office incident reporting database. Leverage technology and investigative tools to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of investigations.
* Ensure timely follow-up and communication regarding all investigation activities, including patient interactions, interviews, research, and workforce interactions.
* Close all investigations and respond to inquiries in accordance with the Compliance Office standards and regulatory deadlines.
* Provide weekly, monthly, and annual metrics and reports on investigation activities.
* Prepare summary findings for various stakeholders, including clinical departments, HR, Faculty Affairs, and Legal.
* Track and ensure consistency and accuracy of investigation procedures across WCM. Conduct periodic quality reviews of completed investigations to ensure adherence to standards and identify areas for improvement.
* Track trends, recommend workflow updates, and suggest improvements to enhance compliance and address non-compliance issues. Document best practices and lessons learned from investigations to build organizational knowledge and improve future practices.
* Keep abreast of changes in relevant laws, regulations, and industry standards. Ensure that investigations and compliance practices remain current and aligned with new requirements.
* Perform other related duties as assigned.
**Education**
-------------


* Bachelor's Degree in related field
* Master's Degree preferred
**Experience**
--------------


* Approximately 5-7 years of investigation experience required, preferably in healthcare, and/or compliance within an academic medical center setting.
* Approximately 5-7 years of experience working with patients on patient complaints.
* Proven experience with investigative techniques and documentation.
**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**
-----------------------------------


* Working knowledge of Federal and State healthcare program requirements and/or knowledge of investigation, clinical, legal, auditing, or other compliance experience.
* In-depth knowledge of regulatory requirements and institutional policies.
* Demonstrated ability to take initiative.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to operate within, and contribute to, a collaborative environment.
* Strong analytical skills, ability to collect information from diverse sources, interpret and apply regulations, policy and legal principles.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with strength in empathic communication.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Able to handle confidential and sensitive information with integrity and discretion.
* Demonstrated ability to analyze complex situations and develop effective solutions.
**Licenses and Certifications**
-------------------------------


* Certification in Compliance preferred.
**Working Conditions/Physical Demands**
---------------------------------------

  


Weill Cornell Medicine is a comprehensive academic medical center that is committed to excellence in patient care, scientific discovery, and the education of future physicians and scientists in New York City and around the world. Our doctors and scientists - faculty from Weill Cornell Medical College, Weill Cornell Graduate School of Medical Sciences, and the Weill Cornell Physician Organization - are engaged in world-class clinical care and cutting-edge research that connect patients to the latest treatment innovations and prevention strategies. Located in the heart of the Upper East Side's scientific corridor, Weill Cornell Medicine's powerful network of collaborators extends to its parent university Cornell University; to Qatar, where an international campus offers a U.S. medical degree; and to programs in Tanzania, Haiti, Brazil, Austria and Turkey. Our medical practices serve communities throughout New York City, and our faculty provide comprehensive care at NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Weill Cornell Medical Center, NewYork-Presbyterian/Lower Manhattan Hospital, NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Brooklyn Methodist Hospital, NewYork-Presbyterian Hospital/Westchester Behavioral Health Center, and NewYork-Presbyterian/Queens. At Weill Cornell Medicine, we work together to treat each individual, not just their conditions or illnesses, as we strive to deliver the finest possible care for our patients - the center of everything we do. Weill Cornell Medicine is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Weill Cornell Medicine provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to protected status, including race, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, or genetic information.

  

  

**Nearest Major Market:** Manhattan
  

**Nearest Secondary Market:** New York City
company_addresses:
1300 York Avenue
New York, NY 10065
Phone: (212) 746-5454
company_description: Weill Cornell Medicine is among the nation's top-ranked medical and graduate schools, striving for excellence in its education of the world's future healthcare leaders.

title: Account Services Analyst
description:
Company Description


MarketAxess is on a journey to digitally transform one of the world’s largest financial markets, enabling the shift from analog, phone-based trading to a fully electronic marketplace. Why does this matter? Because our platform makes trading fixed-income more accessible, ultimately improving transparency, efficiency, and competition in the marketplace. Changing the way an established industry transacts is no easy feat. There will be twists and turns, because no one’s ever done this before. But now, more than 2,000 clients around the world rely on our solutions, and that number is only expected to grow in the years ahead. We know where we’re going. How we get there is up to us. Join us and help Take Us There.

**The Role**



We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Operations Analyst to join our US Account Services (“AS”) team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing and optimizing various operational processes within our team to improve efficiency and effectiveness. The Analyst will work closely with the AS Manager and cross-functional teams to identify areas of improvement, develop solutions, and implement changes to drive operational excellence.



If you are a proactive and results-driven individual with a passion for operational excellence, we invite you to apply for the Account Services Analyst position at MarketAxess. Join our dynamic team and help drive meaningful change within our organization.


**How You'll Help Take Us There**


* Obtain knowledge of the MarketAxess platform and key products
* Produce reports and presentations; perform ad-hoc data analysis to be used for internal and external stakeholders, including trend and performance analysis
* Support the Account Services team with customer onboarding, relationship management, and the training of new users on the platform
* Attend meetings with the Account Services team, including weekly update meetings, customer calls, and goal setting meetings
* Build a professional network with mentors, senior executives, and colleagues across regions and offices
* Gain the necessary skills to receive sponsorship for the requisite FINRA Operations Professional Examination (SIE, Series 99)
* Analyze existing operational processes and workflows to identify inefficiencies and areas for improvement
* Develop and implement strategies to optimize operational processes and enhance overall efficiency
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather data, conduct analysis, and communicate findings
* Provide ongoing support to the Account Services team


**What We’re Looking for**


* Bachelor’s degree preferred, or equivalent experience
* Series 99 preferred, required to be obtained within the first 6 months of the role
* Knowledge of the fixed income markets, preferably investment grade, high yield, Emerging Markets, leveraged loans, credit derivatives and fixed income ETFs
* Experience with MS Office Suite, including Excel, PowerPoint and Access
* Experience with Tableau, Salesforce and Microstrategy preferred
* Knowledge of SQL Query and Programming/Coding is a plus
* Excellent communication skills - written and verbal
* Confidence and comfort interacting with customers and senior leaders
* Results-driven and detail-oriented with the ability to prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously
* Ability to tackle business problems with creative solutions
* Strong relationship builder who values giving and receiving feedback and is agile and eager to learn
* Analytical, quantitative, verbal and written communication skills


**What You Can Expect from Us**


* Hybrid Environment: Our employees enjoy a mix of working in the office and from home
* Free Food: We provide free lunch for employees when they are working in the office. Plus, our offices are stocked with snacks.
* Paid Time Off: Competitive PTO package including vacation and personal days, sick leave and charity days
* Generous Parental Leave: Up to 20 weeks fully paid leave
* 401(k): Dollar-for-dollar employer match up to $17,500
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan: Employees can purchase MarketAxess common stock at a discount
* Wellness Stipend: We provide employees with up to $1K annually towards gym memberships, home office equipment and more
* Onsite Healthcare: We offer convenient access to world-class care through Mount Sinai at our Hudson Yards location
* Tuition Assistance and Professional Development: Benefit from live and on-demand learning, role-specific training, employee-led Lunch and Learns and guest speakers
* Core benefits: Highly competitive medical, dental, and vision programs


For job positions in NYC, NY, and other locations where required, the estimated salary range for a new hire into this position is $60,000 USD to $75,000 USD. Actual salary may vary depending on job-related factors, which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location. You may also be eligible for annual cash incentives, equity, and other benefit programs.



MarketAxess Corporation and its affiliates provide equal employment opportunities to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic in the location in which the candidate is applying.



All of your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

title: Certified and Registered Pharmacy Technician (PTCB or equivalent)
description:
Company Description

PersonalRX, a rapidly growing mail order pharmacy is looking to hire **pharmacy technicians** who have a CPhT (Required) and a NJ technician license (Required). This technician is needed to assist our personal care team as we are adding many new patients every day.

We offer a very competitive salary, annual bonus and ownership (company stock) in our company for high performers as well as promotional opportunities over time.

You do not have to stand and wait on customers all day long and your job responsibilities are varied depending on your experience. Our customers love us because of unique “patient concierge” business model. Check us out at either www.personalrx.com or view our YouTube testimonials (go to YouTube and search for PersonalRX).

We recently raised significant capital and looking to grow in our business by investing in our pharmacy systems and hiring well qualified technicians

Be part of this exciting opportunity and apply now. Someone from our executive team will call you back.

* CPhT **required**
* NJ State license **required**
* Computer experience **required**

**Job Description**

**Certified Patient Care Technician**

* Contact assigned patients at least once/month to review current medications and to determine if there are any changes
* Contact patient's doctors for new or changed prescriptions or if a renewal prescription is needed
* Process a Prior Authorization request, if needed, and enter required information into the system once a response is received
* Work with the QA Analyst and Pharmacists when there is a shipping issue to determine if the order needs to be reshipped
* Work with the Pharmacists when there is an out-of-stock condition and contact the patient or doctor as needed
* Work with the patient to obtain any outstanding account balance
* Complete patient updates as needed (e.g., new address, alternate address, credit card or insurance coverage change)
* Proactively work with the patients at year-end to see if there will be any new coverage/insurance changes in the new year
* Enter test claims for new potential patients to determine their copays
* Update patient notes as needed

Regulatory, Privacy and Other

* Remains active and in good standing with all licensing requirements of the governing states board of pharmacy
* Ensures that all HIPAA regulations regarding patient privacy are followed
* Participate in the company policy for recycling
* Set and complete tasks related to follow-ups in Rx2 to ensure the above work is completed in a timely manner
* Review existing SOPs and Policy and Procedures and enhance/update as needed
* Identify issues/topics that require a new policy or procedure - and share with management

All functions or duties of the registered pharmacy technicians shall be performed under the direct supervision of the pharmacists on duty. The pharmacists on duty will be working in close proximity with the registered pharmacy technicians to ensure adequate control or supervision and shall verify and document registered pharmacy technician work.

**Note: All staff may be cross trained in another related pharmacy jobs.**

Compensation

- Base salary $22 to $23/hour

- Bonus (based on performance)

- Stock options (based on performance)

- Health benefits

- Opportunities for advancement

Pay: $23.00 - $24.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

* Dental insurance
* Employee stock ownership plan
* Health insurance
* Opportunities for advancement

* Vision insurance

Physical Setting:

* Office

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

* retail pharmacy: 2 years (Required)

title: Warehouse Associate
description:
*Grow With Us!*  

  

Hudson is North America's leading travel retailer. For over 30 years, Hudson has met the needs and wants of travelers in more than 1,000 duty-free, duty-paid, and food & beverage stores.  


**What we will offer you:**
* Competitive rate of pay: **$16.00 an hour**
* Daily Pay- Get your money as you earn it
* 20% Hudson Employee Discount
* 50% Hudson Food and Beverage Discount
* PTO
* Personal and Parental Leave Programs
* Medical, Dental & Vision Insurance
* Company Paid Life Insurance
* Employee Recognition Programs
* Advancement and Growth Opportunities
* On-going Training & Development
* Referral Bonus up to $500

**This Warehouse Associate Job Is For You, If You Enjoy:**
* Helping the team by picking orders and receiving freight
* Working at the **Grand Central Station**

**Your Team is counting on you as a Warehouse Associate to:**
* Open availability to work
* Work a full-time schedule

**Warehouse Associate Key Responsibilities:**
* Protects all company assets in the warehouse including non-stock merchandise
* Provides a safe and clean environment for warehouse personnel
* Places stock orders as required
* Counts and receives incoming merchandise; reports shortages/overages to management in a timely manner, before required deadlines
* Counts and completes all appropriate paperwork for merchandise returns to vendors
* Provides ongoing stock replenishment to the sales floor
* Isolates, sorts, and organizes all damaged and outdated products for subsequent supplier credits and returns
* Organizes all merchandise for annual inventory
* Assists in inventory and reconciliation of inventory variances
* Notify management of out of stock merchandise
* Assist in stocking of stores and backrooms
* Assist in trash removal and recycling

**Required Qualifications:**
* Attention to detail with a high degree of accuracy
* Ability to communicate effectively
* Good time-management skills and problem-solving abilities
* Ability to multi-task
* Ability to lift 50lbs
* Ability to work in environment exposed to the elements, both hot and cold
* Previous warehouse experience
* Previous experience operating a pallet jack
* High School Diploma or equivalent

Hudson is an Equal Opportunity Employer of all qualified individuals. All employment decisions are made without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, military leave or veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state or local law. We are committed to creating an inclusive workplace in which we value diversity and unique experiences, backgrounds and identities.  

  

**All offers are contingent upon successful completion and passing of background checks and/or employment verification results.**  


**Note to staffing agencies:** Please do not contact Hudson (including the recruitment team or any hiring managers) regarding this position with candidates. If assistance is needed in filling any position for Hudson, a member of our recruiting team will reach out directly.

title: Conflicts Center of Excellence- Analyst
description:
The Conflicts Center of Excellence supports our audit engagement teams in meeting their regulatory requirements related to identifying potential conflicts of interest. If you demonstrate good judgement in a risk-management environment, are inquisitive, and enjoy working on a challenging, client-service oriented team, we’d love to discuss an opportunity for you in the Conflicts Center of Excellence (Conflicts COE)!

**Work you’ll do**


As an Analyst in the Conflicts CoE, you’ll use your analytical, research and investigative skills to:

* Work closely with Conflicts CoE Managers and Senior Managers, Lead Client Service Partners, Deloitte Independence Directors, Audit engagement teams, global Conflicts teams, and teams across Deloitte’s businesses to support audit teams in maintaining auditor independence and identifying potential conflicts of interest.
* You will support engagement teams with:
+ Submitting conflict checks to a centralized Conflicts team
+ Following up with relevant US and Global contacts to obtain feedback on services and relationships
+ Assessing of services and relationships for risk categorization
+ Applying independence rules and policy to client-specific fact patterns
+ Preparing final independence assessments to be reviewed by Managers and Senior Managers
+ Raising potential conflicts to Managers and Senior Managers for evaluation
+ Engagement with the global Independence & Conflicts Network as needed
+ Engagement with Enterprise Portfolio Management team as needed

* Work on various projects at the direction of Managers and Senior Managers, to prepare internal documentation and educational materials, as well as presentations to the external stakeholders of the process (i.e., the broader Independence & Conflicts Network, engagement teams, audit practice, etc.)
* Assist Managers and Senior Managers in the development of procedures, and implementing process improvements for the Conflicts CoE
* Work collaboratively with team members in India

**The successful candidate will possess:**

* Strong oral and written communications
* Outstanding attention to detail along with strong technical, organizational and analysis skills
* Ability to multi-task and prioritize
* Good working knowledge of Excel and PowerPoint, experience working with MS Teams, Outlook
* Excellent business writing skills
* Excellent organizational skills
* Client-service oriented mindset
* Interest in untangling puzzles

***The team***


The Conflicts CoE team performs a critical quality-assurance and risk-management function for the Deloitte U.S. firm, helping the organization remain unbiased and free from conflicts-of-interest, in fact and appearance, when providing services to attest/audit clients. Independence requirements are defined by specific sets of policies, external rules and regulations, so maintaining both the independence of the Deloitte U.S. firm and its professionals is essential to the business and reputation of Deloitte.

**Risk & Brand Protection (R&BP)**


Our reputation starts with you—this belief is core to R&BP Office, which brings together six essential core areas that shape our culture—we collectively work with our businesses to inspire new standards of integrity, trust, and performance to make an impact that matters and to better serve our clients, our communities and our people. With our people’s help, we distinguish Deloitte as the clear leader in professional services, making Deloitte the first choice for clients and talent. Together, we protect, preserve, and enhance our reputation and distinguish Deloitte as the undisputed leader in professional services, strengthening our brand, and each other.

**Independence & Conflicts Network (ICN)**


Independence is integrity, professional skepticism, intellectual honesty, and objectivity — freedom from conflicts of interest. The people of Deloitte must remain unbiased and free from conflicts of interest with our clients, in fact and appearance. Deloitte's independence requirements are defined by specific sets of policies and external rules and regulations to help us remain independent when providing service and creating business relationships.

**Qualifications**

**Required:**

* Bachelors’ degree
* Years of experience 1-2
* Ability to travel 0-10%, on average, based on rare travel for team meetings
* Limited Sponsorship maybe available

**Preferred:**

* Experience of Independence requirements for professional auditing firms

*Information for applicants with a need for accommodation:* *https://www2.deloitte.com/us/en/pages/careers/articles/join-deloitte-assistance-for-disabled-applicants.html*


EA\\_ExpHire


**Recruiting tips**  

  

From developing a stand out resume to putting your best foot forward in the interview, we want you to feel prepared and confident as you explore opportunities at Deloitte.
**Benefits**  

  

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.
**Our people and culture**  

  

Our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture empowers our people to be who they are, contribute their unique perspectives, and make a difference individually and collectively. It enables us to leverage different ideas and perspectives, and bring more creativity and innovation to help solve our client most complex challenges. This makes Deloitte one of the most rewarding places to work.
**Our purpose**  

Deloitte’s purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and in our communities. We are creating trust and confidence in a more equitable society. At Deloitte, purpose is synonymous with how we work every day. It defines who we are. We are focusing our collective efforts to advance sustainability, equity, and trust that come to life through our core commitments.
**Professional development**  

  

From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to build new skills, take on leadership opportunities and connect and grow through mentorship. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.
As used in this posting, “Deloitte” means Deloitte LLP. Please see www.deloitte.com/us/about for a detailed description of the legal structure of Deloitte LLP and its subsidiaries.


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

title: Audit Supervisor - Global Corporate and Investment Banking
description:
**JOB DESCRIPTION**

**Job Title**: Audit Supervisor - Global Corporate and Investment Banking

**Location:** New York, NY, US  
**Type:** Hybrid (3 days onsite)

**Job Description**

As an **Audit Supervisor** in the Global Corporate and Investment Banking (GCIB) audit team, you will be responsible for independently performing complex audit activities across multiple Lines of Business (LOBs). This role involves designing and executing audit tests, assessing issues for business impact, recommending severity ratings, and establishing strong business partner relationships.

The Audit Supervisor will be working with global teams based in EMEA and APAC, covering audits in areas such as equity capital markets, debt capital markets, investment banking, corporate banking coverage, and leasing. The team also handles credit risk management and global payment services audits in EMEA. You are expected to work independently in your assigned areas and may lead small audits.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Execute audit strategy using risk-based auditing, define audit scope and programs, and leverage automation and innovative methods to ensure timely and high-quality results.
* Apply deep knowledge of products, business, and technical expertise to effectively challenge management and improve the control environment.
* Assess impacts on business processes, controls, and strategies to provide recommendations on severity ratings.
* Provide input on draft audit reports and share audit results with business leaders.
* Support the development of peers and teams through on-the-job training, fostering an inclusive work environment.
* Establish and maintain business partner relationships with line management to develop deep business knowledge.
* Utilize innovative tools to complete audit activities efficiently.
* Support multiple projects using technology and analytical techniques in a fast-paced environment.

**Required Qualifications:**

* **Experience:**
* 5-7 years of internal audit, front office business control, compliance, or risk management experience covering corporate and investment banking (e.g., equity capital markets, debt capital markets, investment banking, corporate banking, leasing).
* 2+ years of experience auditing the Investment Banking Business within an organization (GCIB).
* **Skills:**
* Proactive with a positive attitude, ownership mentality, flexibility, and intellectual curiosity.
* Strong organizational, analytical, oral, and written communication skills.
* **Education:**
* Bachelor's degree.

**Desired Qualifications:**

* **Experience:**
* Coaching less experienced team members.
* Working in a large global bank.
* **Certifications:**
* Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Financial Risk Manager (FRM), Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), or relevant qualifications.

**Skills:**

* Analytical Thinking
* Audit Planning
* Internal Audit Review
* Issue Management
* Risk Management
* Attention to Detail
* Automation
* Business Acumen
* Project Management
* Technical Documentation
* Coaching and Mentorship
* Critical Thinking
* Relationship Building
* Written Communication
* Knowledge of banking products and processes
* Familiarity with risk and controls in corporate and investment banking
* Sound judgment regarding gaps and risks

title: Membership Services & Reservations agent
description:
**The Opportunity:**

The Century Association is seeking a Membership Services & Reservations Agent (MSRA) to join the team. The new MSRA will be responsible for handling the day-to-day needs and desires of the Club’s membership. The candidate must possess the ability to work well with others and have excellent interpersonal skills. Prior customer service experience is a necessity. This role offers a unique opportunity to be an integral part of a prestigious Private Club, contributing to the cultivation of an exclusive and welcoming environment for our members and their guests.

**The Club**

The Century Association, established in 1847, stands as a renowned private club located in the heart of Midtown New York City. Century takes pride in its rich history, serving as the foundation for a vibrant and inclusive community of accomplished individuals.

Here are a number of compelling reasons why you might find The Century an exciting place to further your career:

*Legacy of Excellence*: The Century has a longstanding tradition of excellence in fostering intellectual, cultural, and social pursuits. Joining the team means becoming part of an institution with a rich heritage and a commitment to upholding the highest standards of quality and service.

*Professional Development*: As a management professional, you will benefit from a dynamic work environment which encourages continuous learning and development. Century invests in its staff, providing opportunities for skill enhancement, leadership training, and career advancement, and providing a unique opportunity for personal and professional growth.

*Prime Location*: Situated in the heart of Manhattan, The Century offers a prestigious address and convenient access to transportation, and the city's cultural, business, and entertainment hubs. This prime location enhances both professional and personal experiences, making work-life balance achievable.

*Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion*: The Century is dedicated to fostering a diverse and inclusive community. We value the unique perspectives and backgrounds that each team member brings, creating a dynamic and supportive workplace where all are recognized and celebrated.

**Position Summary:**

The MSRA for the Century will be a dedicated professional overseeing daily communications with the membership. The member’s experience and the means by which the Club handles the member’s needs is a hallmark of the Club. Known for attention to detail, the MSRA will handle reservations, and questions. Beyond managing inquiries, the MSRA will excel in coordinating reservations for club events, and thus ensuring members' access to social events and amenities. He/She will adeptly handle event logistics, from securing reservations to managing guest lists, to guarantee a flawless experience for members and guests. With a keen eye for detail, the MSRA will prioritize personalized service, proactively addressing members', and contribute to the overall satisfaction of the club's membership. His/her role combines administrative finesse with a commitment to fostering a vibrant and engaging social environment within the club setting.

**Duties and Responsibilities:**

Reporting to Director of Food & Beverage, the MSRA’s responsibilities include:

**Membership Management:**

* Manage databases for formatting mailing lists.
* Coordinate related meetings to include reminders, seating arrangements, programs, document preparation, attendance records and minutes.
* Assist with reciprocal club requests and requirements for members.
* Prepare mailings of invitations, notices of meetings, minutes, etc. to members of various committees.

**Member Engagement:**

* Act as the primary point of contact for members, ensuring a personalized and attentive experience.
* Proactively address member inquiries, requests, and concerns.
* Provide assistance to members which includes but not limited to; reservations for functions, programs or dining, directions, administrative functions for committees.

**Event Reservation Coordination:**

* Handles reservations for club events, including dinners, parties, and social gatherings.
* Collaborate with other departments to ensure seamless event logistics.

**Communication:**

* Communicate effectively with members regarding upcoming events.
* Provide clear and concise information to Members and guests.
* Answers office telephone extensions, aiding members as requested, forwarding calls when possible or taking messages. • Answers website, general mailbox, and reservation e-mails, replies or directs messages accordingly.

**Problem Resolution:**

* Address issues or challenges which may be brought to the attention of the MSRA by following Club procedure on a timely basis.

**Collaboration:**

* Work closely with the management and staff to enhance the overall member experience.

**Record Keeping:**

* Maintain accurate and organized records of inquiries and reservations.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in a customer service or hospitality role is required.

· Good verbal and written communication skills.

* Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
* Excellent interpersonal abilities.

· Have a high-level attention to detail.

* Familiarity with event coordination and reservation systems is a plus.
* Commitment to delivering a high level of service and professionalism.

**Education & Experience:**

· At least 2 years’ experience in a similar or related role in a hospitality or customer service environment.

* Capacity to apply discretion and maintain a high level of confidentiality when handling sensitive information.

**Physical Requirements**

* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer
* Must be able to access and navigate each department at the Club’s facilities.
* Ability to frequently lift and/or move up to 5 to 10 pounds.

**Compensation**

The annual salary range for this position is between $60,000.00 and $70,000.00 based on the candidate’s experience, skill set, education, and other criteria. The Century offers full benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, vacation, sick pay, and Holiday Fund.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Flexible spending account
* Food provided

* Vision insurance

title: Executive Assistant
description:
**About Us:-**

Since its founding in 2017, Prometheum has leveraged its deep expertise in securities law, blockchain and trading to create a compliant ecosystem for digital asset securities that enables all investors to seamlessly invest in digital assets securities. Prometheum has relied on its strong diverse team to build the tools to service digital asset securities. To date, Prometheum has built multiple broker-dealers traversing novel areas and a large technology stack (intersecting trading, blockchain, compliance, etc.). We continue to grow and are looking for hardworking hungry individuals that can contribute to our already great fintech company culture as we traverse new and exciting areas that require a thirst for solving complicated problems.

**Role:-**

Executive Assistant - Full Time W2

**Location:-**   
New York City - HQ. (Onsite)

**Salary:-**   
$50,000 - $70,000

**Responsibilities:-**

* Maintain briefing materials and talking points for meetings and speaking opportunities.
* Maintain an extremely detailed calendar and related logistics.
* Assist in other Board/Director matters as needed, including but not limited to, preparing correspondence and other communications, file organization, research.
* Interact with senior level business leaders in a professional and effective manner both in person and written.
* Can be relied upon to do the job as well as being willing to help other team members when needed.
* Maintain understanding of firm policies.
* Manage complex calendars, including scheduling, rescheduling and moving things around based on priorities and needs.
* Inbox management.
* Coordinate travel arrangements, including flights, booking cars, and making all reservations
* Oversee all administrative aspects.
* Identify, prepare, and compile necessary materials to ensure that the Executives have appropriate information for meetings, presentations, and special projects, as needed
* Manage sensitive and confidential information with discretion
* Serve as the first point of contact for a wide variety of high-level relationships between Executives and industry professionals.
* Develop in-depth knowledge of complex relationships with partners, vendors, and industry professionals.
* Participate in meetings and assist with special projects as needed, including planning special events, board meetings, and off-site meetings.
* Partner and work closely with a diverse range of individuals at all levels in the industry and organization.
* Miscellaneous personal errands.
* Manage and assist with all company events.
* Be proactive and have the ability to think ahead to anticipate the needs and requests of the Executives.
* Assist with onboarding of new employees to the business.
* Manage technology inventory for the business.
* Assist in making our office environment an enjoyable space for all.

**Qualifications:-**

* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal.
* High attention to detail, strong organizational skills and excellent follow-through.
* Trustworthy to handle highly sensitive and confidential information.
* Highest degree of integrity, professionalism, diplomacy and discretion required.
* Comfortable working with people at all organizational levels, particularly the senior-most leadership levels.
* Ability to work well under pressure, adapt to unexpected events, and prioritize and multi- task in a deadline driven environment.
* Must have excellent judgment and be resourceful.
* Team player with a positive attitude.

**Benefits:-**

* Competitive salary based on experience
* Excellent benefits including:- Health, Vision & Dental Insurance

Prometheum is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Manufacturing Technology Teacher - Anticipated
description:
**JOB TITLE: MANUFACTURING TECHNOLOGY TEACHER - ANTICIPATED**

**REPORTS TO: Principal** 

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* **Valid New Jersey Instructional Certificate in the area of expertise**
* **Demonstrated knowledge of effective teaching methods and developmentally appropriate classroom activities**
* **Ability to maintain a positive learning environment**
* **Digital fluency is required.**
* **Strong interpersonal and communication skills**
* **Required criminal history background check and proof of U.S. citizenship or legal resident alien status**

**SUPERVISES:**

**Students, and when assigned, student teachers and classroom aides**

**JOB GOAL:**

**To provide an educational setting and establish a class environment that fosters learning and personal growth; to help students develop skills, attitudes, and knowledge needed to provide a good foundation for continued education; and to maintain good relationships with parents and other staff members.**

**POSITION OVERVIEW:**  
**We are seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Manufacturing Technology Teacher to join our Engineering & Technology Education Department. This full-time position is responsible for teaching a three-part series of courses—Manufacturing Technology I, II, and III—designed to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the manufacturing industry. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in manufacturing processes, machine shop practices, woodworking, metal fabrication, and welding. They will also possess a passion for fostering student growth and preparing them for entry-level employment in the manufacturing sector or post-high school training.**

**PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* **Works to enhance the educational experiences of children through the creation of a supportive learning environment and the use of developmentally appropriate materials and practices.**
* **Promotes active learning using structured and unstructured activities that foster the social, physical, cognitive, and emotional development of students.**
* **Implements the approved curriculum and uses appropriate learning activities designed to foster learning at each child’s developmental level. Works to achieve district educational goals and objectives and state core curriculum content standards.**
* **Develops lesson plans and instructional materials and provide individualized and small group instruction in order to adapt the curriculum to the needs of each pupil. Balances teacher-directed and child-initiated experiences.**
* **Sets specific objectives wherever possible in lesson preparation and weekly lesson plans and carries through presentation to effectively achieve these objectives.**
* **Observes students in a variety of settings and evaluates the cognitive, social, and emotional skills of students, and maintains records of progress toward stated objectives of instruction.**
* **Maintains records of students' educational progress in class record books and/or board-approved forms and summarizes these marks for reporting purposes.**
* **Develops and uses age-appropriate assessment tools and maintains records of students’ development and educational progress in class record books and/or approved forms and summarizes these marks for reporting purposes.**
* **Identifies student needs and cooperates with other professional staff members in assessing and resolving learning problems.**
* **Establishes and maintains standards of student behavior needed to achieve a classroom climate conducive to learning.**
* **Budgets class time effectively.**
* **Communicates with parents through conferences and other means to inform them about the school program and to discuss student progress.**
* **Assists in facilitating a smooth transition from grade to grade, working collaboratively with grade level/content level teachers**
* **Maintains professional competence and continuous improvement through in-service education and other professional growth activities.**
* **Participates in school-level planning, faculty meetings/committees, and other school system groups.**
* **Makes effective use of community resources to enhance the instructional program.**
* **Upholds and enforces school rules, administrative regulations, and board policy.**
* **Performs other duties within the scope of his/her employment and certification as may be assigned.**

**TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT:**

**Salary and work year to be determined as mutually agreed upon in the Collective Bargaining Agreement.**

title: Research Scientist
description:
**Job Description:**  
The Research Scientist will be a key member in a small team performing hands-on research and development of next generation Group III-V and II-VI thin-film solar materials.

This position will include a variety of laboratory activities including sputter deposition, thermal evaporation and sublimation, inorganic chemistry (solution processing), photo lithography, material characterization (SEM/EDS, UV-Vis, Profilometry) and solar cell testing.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in chemical and electrical engineering, a general understanding of semiconductor physics, and be comfortable working in a hands-on capacity in a research laboratory.

Candidates should also have a strong background in chemical processes, a working knowledge of common chemical compatibilities, an ability to perform solution processing (dilution calculations, etc.), and a general working knowledge related to the safe handling, disposal and safety protocols commonly used with strong acids, bases, and solvents.

Candidates will also receive training in the standard operating procedures related to thin film deposition and material characterization with spectrophotometers, solar simulators, ICP-OES, profilometry and SEM/EDS.

This position will be an in-person role, working in a laboratory facility located in Monmouth Junction, NJ.

**Qualifications & Experience**

* B.S. in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, Physics or Relevant Field
* Experience with Chemical Processing in Laboratory Fume Hoods
* Knowledge of Sputter Deposition, Thermal Evaporation and High Vacuum Deposition Processes
* Experience with Spectrophotometers, ICP-OES, SEM+EDS and/or Keithley Source Meter Units (SMU's)
* A General Understanding of Photovoltaic Materials and/or Thin-Film Solar Cells
* Have a working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint

**Ideal Personal Attributes**

* Have excellent teamwork, communication, and people skills.
* Be self-directed, organized, and motivated to accomplish assigned goals.
* Able to multi-task and work in a fast-paced, challenging environment.
* Have a passion for excellence and detailed, high-quality results.

title: Physical Therapy Aide
description:
If you’re looking for a rewarding career that contributes to helping people restore their active, pain-free lives, consider joining the Kayal Orthopedic Center team. We have an exciting opportunity for a PT Aide to work in our Ramsey location.

The hours are 3pm-7pm Mon-Fri. This shift also has rotating Saturdays about once a month from 8am-1pm.

***Job Duties:***

Assist with patient intake

Observe patients, document patients responses and progress

Liaise with physicians' offices and hospital personnel

Prepare treatment room for patient by following prescribed procedures and protocols.

Prepare patients for physical treatment, educate patients by demonstrating proper use of equipment and exercises.

Help assist the Physician Therapist and Physician Therapy Assistant by providing heat packs, paraffin dips.

Help patients onto exercise equipment, monitor motion, track walking time and distance, measure mobility, perform prescribed exercises and strengthening techniques.

Maintain safe and clean working environment by following procedures, rules and regulations i.e. clean beds, gym equipment, PT modalities.

Ensure operation of physical therapy equipment, complete preventive maintenance, call for repairs.

Maintain physical therapy supplies inventory, anticipate needs, place and expedite orders.

When you join one of our 12 convenient locations, you become a part of Kayal Orthopedic Center unrivaled record of achievement, education and advancement as we revolutionize healthcare together. We work hard to acquire and retain the best people, and to create a welcoming, nurturing work environment where you can develop professionally. We share the belief that all employees, regardless of job title or expertise, can make an impact on quality patient care.
