title: Customer Success Representative
description:
Radancy is transforming how companies connect with candidates through our SaaS talent acquisition platform. As a Customer Success Representative at Radancy, you’ll work collaboratively to ensure the satisfaction and retention of our customers by providing exceptional customer service and support of our cloud-based platform. Interacting daily with your customers and teams, you’ll help execute data-driven strategies that fully maximize ROI across our Radancy Talent Acquisition Cloud. Your elevated customer relations skills, resourcefulness, and ongoing eagerness to learn will drive success in this role. This entry level role is your gateway to many different career paths at Radancy.

  


*Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every one of the qualifications in a job description. Our top priority is finding the best candidate for the job and if you are interested in the position, we would encourage you to apply, even if you don’t believe you meet every one of the qualifications below.*

  


**Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with Customer Success team members to manage all assigned tasks to achieve customer goals and key performance indicators (KPIs):
	+ Create insertion orders and project request forms to administer media and programmatic requests
	+ Ensure internal and customer meetings are scheduled, productive and accurately documented for future reference
	+ Maintain accurate data and project details and enter into billing and ticketing systems
* Support ongoing project efforts to ensure our Radancy Talent Acquisition Cloud is a productive part of your customers’ strategy
* Provide excellent customer service and support through effective communication and a high attention to detail
* Keep up to date with product developments and best practices

  


**Qualifications:**

* 0-1 years of experience with a desire to learn new skills in the software industry
* Strong project and time management as well as organizational skills
* Excellent attention to detail
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with an openness to providing feedback to help iterate the business
* B2B SaaS (Software as a Service) Customer Success, Account Management, consulting and/or sales experience is highly valued

  


**Company Values:** At Radancy, we are dedicated to the core values that guide our work and culture:

* **Innovative Tech:** We leverage transformative technology to optimize talent acquisition strategies.
* **Impactful Solutions:** Our work makes a difference, strengthening organizations and connecting people to meaningful careers.
* **Data-Driven Results:** We deliver data-driven, strategic solutions that increase ROI and drive performance.
* **Supportive Teams:** Collaboration empowers our growth and success, with a focus on well-being and professional development.

  


**Location:** This role is hybrid, with a requirement of 2 days in the office.

  


**Life and Wellness at Radancy:** At Radancy, we prioritize your well-being and offer a comprehensive range of benefits and perks designed to enhance your life, both professionally and personally. Our total rewards package reflects our commitment to ensuring you have the support you need to thrive. Here's a glimpse of what you can expect:

  

* Medical including plans with **100% coverage for most in-network services**, Dental, Vision, Life and AD&D Insurance, Supplemental Life Insurance, Health Care FSA, Dependent Care FSA, Transportation FSA, Parking FSA , Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
* The **Radancy Give Back Day** Program allows our employees to contribute to their communities by volunteering one day per quarter. This initiative promotes collaboration and enriches lives while supporting local organizations chosen by each office location.
* Experience a range of 9 dynamic diversity programs, coordinated by ERGs and Marketing, including 48+ live sessions and 25 individual of Each One Teach One content. From wellness initiatives like Mental Health Moments and Mindfulness Club to educational events such as Pronouns Workshop and Dialogues Panels, our programs are rooted in education and intention, fostering a culture of inclusivity and growth.
* As part of our **Onboarding Recognition Program**, you can thank those who helped you settle in by sharing eGift cards. It's one of the ways we appreciate your contribution and value the relationships you build here.
* Opportunities for professional development and career growth in a dynamic global company.

  


**Salary Range:** USD $45,000.00 – $50,000.00\\*
  

* The above range is based on a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years and depth of experience, certifications, and specific office location.
  


*Radancy is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes all qualified applicants regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We actively work to create an inclusive environment where all of our employees can thrive. If you require any accommodations during the application process, please reach out to us at* *, and we will work with you to meet your needs.*

title: Divisional Director, ORS
description:
Description:
**BASIC FUNCTION**: The Divisional Director, ORS is responsible for the management and direction of the clinical department and functions collaboratively with the Nurse Supervisors and Medical Directors to plan, implement and evaluate treatment approaches.


The Divisional Director, of ORS, will be able to manage multiple clinical and operational priorities. Will have exceptional interpersonal skills and cultivate positive and productive relationships with clients and staff. The individual will be a positive problem-solver and incorporates new treatment approaches.

**MAJOR DUTIES****:**

* Supervises all clinical and administrative functions of the MTP Departments.
* Actively and consistently conducts him/herself as a professional role-model.
* Actively works to enhance the morale of all staff.
* Actively creates an atmosphere that supports the professional development of staff of all disciplines.
* Identifies with and supports LESC as a whole - not only with the programs for which they are directly responsible.
* Maintains collegial and collaborative relationships with those in other agency programs and departments.
* Guides the diagnostic processes, clinical analyses and development of treatment plans.
* Monitors casework record keeping according to established guidelines.
* Writes staff evaluations, recommends promotions, raises, terminations, etc.
* Responsible for the quality of therapeutic care rendered in the departments, making sure a therapeutic atmosphere prevails which is conducive to patient rehabilitation and staff morale.
* Develops programs to manage crises, violence or other acting-out behaviors.
* Collaborates with the Medical Director.
* Conducts on-going evaluation of department functions to assure delivery of quality service to patients and to insure that treatment plans are administered, and makes recommendations for changes as appropriate.
* Implements the policies of the appropriate regulatory agencies.
* Integrates plans and activities with other departments.
* Chairs staff meetings with TB Prevention program staff.
* Implements and oversees the integration of TB Prevention program plans and activities with CTRPN/Primary Care and other departments as needed.
* Assists staff in developing their professional abilities through group and case conferences.
* Conducts ongoing training programs for staff.
* Fills in for other staff out on leave as needed.

description:
Description:

We are a technology-driven company. We built our business with the purpose of empowering people and improving their organizations, one payment at a time.


We started our journey by providing smart and simple payment processing tools and products but haven’t stopped there. We are backed by a team of world-class experts and the best technology talent, and we are committed to helping more new businesses get started, increase the revenues of our customers, and bridge the gap between online merchants and payment solutions.


Our mission is to give companies the tools they need to change the future of their business.

 **Job Summary**


The Accounts Receivable Specialist plays a crucial role in managing the financial health of our payment processing operations. This role is responsible for overseeing the entire accounts receivable process, ensuring accurate billing, timely collections, and effective communication with clients.


Requirements:
* Prepare, review, and send accurate invoices to clients based on services rendered, ensuring compliance with company policies
* Verify the accuracy of billing information and resolve any discrepancies or issues
* Contact clients via phone, email, and other communication channels to secure payment and resolve any outstanding issues
* Process incoming payments through various channels, including ACH, credit card, and wire transfers, ensuring accurate application to client accounts
* Maintain accurate and organized records of all transactions, communications, and documentation related to accounts receivable
* Prepare and present weekly/monthly reports on collections status, outstanding invoices, and cash flow projections
* Identify opportunities to improve the accounts receivable process, including automation and streamlining workflows
* Other duties as assigned

**Skills/Competencies**

* Judgment and resourcefulness to solve problems independently
* Strong technical aptitude and willingness to learn
* Strong analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to manage client relationships effectively
* Must possess strong communication skills (in English) both verbal and written

 **Qualifications / Experience Required**

* 5-7+ years of experience in accounts receivable, billing, collections, or a relevant field
* Prior experience in payment processing or financial services industry
* Experience with various computer skills: Microsoft Access, Word, Outlook, and Internet savvy.
* Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel
* Possess knowledge of the acquiring business with respect to industry trends, business risk factors, and other operational procedures associated with booking merchants

**Education Requirements**

* Undergraduate college degree preferred

**Physical Requirements**

* Prolonged computer use
* Prolonged sitting

title: Emergency Medical Technician
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Emergency Medical Technician
  

**Job Category** AFSCME Local 888
  

**Department** IPO-Emergency Services
  

**Overview**
The Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O) employs a workforce of approximately 2,700 staff, represented by 15 collective negotiations agreements, and is responsible for institutional strategic initiatives and operations, which encompasses an expansive range of comprehensive service and business operations across the State of New Jersey. These include planning and construction, facilities, public safety and emergency operations, environmental health and safety, transportation, housing, and auxiliary/retail operations.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking an Emergency Medical Technician for the Division of Institutional Planning & Operations (IP&O). This position works under the direct supervision of the Captain or his/her designee, provides emergency medical treatment at the scene and during transport to a medical facility.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Answers all calls for emergency medical treatment; drives the ambulance to required location.
* Determines the nature and extent of the injury and establishes priorities for and renders emergency care.
* Prepares victims for transportation and cares for patients during trips to the hospital or Student Health Center.
* Provides doctor or nurse with an evaluation of the patient’s condition; prepares a detailed report of incident,
* Replaces supplies used and returns ambulance to ready status.
* Provides non-emergency ambulance transportation for University personnel.
* May provide mutual aid to neighboring municipalities during medical emergencies.
* Participates in the department’s Rescue Taskforce program, attending training as directed.
* Shall assist in new employee orientation as directed by the Captain.
* Inspects and provides general maintenance to the ambulance and reports any deficiencies of required equipment and supplies daily to ensure full operational readiness.
* Handles assigned tasks to fulfill the mission of the Emergency Services, such as training, supply maintenance, billing, etc.
* Maintains the departmental record system on hazardous materials in accordance with Federal and State “Right-to-Know” and related legislation.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift**
  

**Work Arrangement**
  

**FLSA** Nonexempt
  

**Grade** 16
  

**Position Salary**
  

**Annual Minimum Salary** 041653.50
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 049085.18
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 056516.85
  

**Standard Hours** 40.00
  

**Union Description** AFSCME - Local 888
  

**Payroll Designation** PERS
  

**Benefits**
Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees. For details, please go to **http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview**.  

  

**Seniority Unit** Security Officers – New Brunswick
  

**Terms of Appointment** Staff - 12 month
  

**Position Pension Eligibility**  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* High school/vocational school education or equivalent and two (2) years’ experience working as an emergency medical technician.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
The following certifications are required and must be maintained for the duration of employment in this position:* Current certification as an emergency medical technician through completion of the New Jersey Department of Health (DOH) accredited Emergency Medical Technician training program.
* Current certification as American Heart Association BLS-Healthcare Provider (or DOH approved equivalent) in cardiopulmonary resuscitation; completion of an Incident Management IS-100, IS-200, IS-700, IS-800 Course (or equivalent).
* Shall participate in the Department’s Rescue Taskforce program, attending training as directed.
* Valid driver’s license, two years driving experience and upon employment must successfully complete the Rutgers Defensive Driving Course.

  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
  

**Preferred Qualifications**
  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* May be required to work various shifts including days, evening, nights, weekends and holidays. Knowledge of basic computer officer applications preferred
* Must wear a respirator and must be able to pass a medical clearance examination and mask fit test.
* All candidates must possess the physical strength to lift/move patients as well as perform routine related tasks.


  

**Special Conditions**
* Shift hours/Schedule: Varies: 0730-1600 or 1530-0000 or 2330-0800
* Clean Driving Record
  

Posting Details
**Posting Number** 24ST2047
  

**Posting Open Date** 08/22/2024
  

**Special Instructions to Applicants**
Notice to AFSCME Local 888 union members ONLY: To submit an internal bid, an application must be submitted no later than 9:00 a.m. on Friday, 08/30/2024. Although AFSCME Local 888 members have priority consideration, outside applications are accepted as well.

**Home Location Campus** Rutgers University - New Brunswick
  

**City** New Brunswick
  

**State** NJ
  

**Location Details**

All offers of employment are contingent upon successful completion of all pre-employment screenings.
Immunization Requirements
Under Policy 100.3.1 Immunization Policy for Covered Individuals, if employment will commence during Flu Season, Rutgers University may require certain prospective employees to provide proof that they are vaccinated against Seasonal Influenza for the current Flu Season, unless the University has granted the individual a medical or religious exemption. Additional infection control and safety policies may apply. Prospective employees should speak with their hiring manager to determine which policies apply to the role or position for which they are applying. title: Program Assistant (Food Pantry)
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Program Assistant (Food Pantry)
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Administrative & Support
  

**Department** SHP-Dean's office-Admin
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.
Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.
Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.
Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers School of Health Professions (SHP) is seeking a Program Assistant for the department of Clinical and Preventive Nutritional Sciences.The RBHS Food Pantry Program Assistant is responsible for supporting the operations and coordination of the food pantry. Working under the supervision of the Administrative Manager, the Program Assistant will perform a variety of tasks including organizing food inventory, assisting in food distribution, coordinating volunteer schedules, and maintaining documentation and statistical records.  

  

Among the key duties of this position include the following:* Oversees and participates in weekly food pantry operations including, but not limited to, food ordering, accepting food delivery, organizing pantry items, managing inventory, opening pantry for designated hours, assisting pantry customers, ensuring confidentiality of all using food pantry.
* Serves as an agency representative, maintaining compliance and reporting as required by Community Food Bank of New Jersey and other partners.
* Supports community health events.
* Oversees all volunteers including recruitment, training, scheduling, and supervising.
* Supports data collection as required by University, researchers, and funders.
* Identifies and pursues funding opportunities for food pantry and other community activities (such as health fairs) including researching aligned funders, writing grant applications, and maintaining grant reporting compliance.
* Performs other related duties as assigned.
* Understands and adheres to Rutgers’ compliance standards as they appear in RBHS’s Corporate Compliance Policy, Code of Conduct and Conflict of Interest Policy.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift**
  

**Work Arrangement**
Consistent with the current application of Rutgers Policy 60.3.22, this position may be eligible for a hybrid work arrangement. The flexible work arrangements outlined in Rutgers Policy 60.3.22 are part of a pilot program that is effective September 1, 2022 through August 31, 2024. Therefore, there is no guarantee that this flexible work arrangement will continue beyond that date. Flexible work arrangements are not permanent, are subject to change or cancellation and contingent on the employee receiving approval in the FlexWork@RU Application System. Additional information may be found at **https://futureofwork.rutgers.edu**.
  

**FLSA** Exempt
  

**Grade** 20S
  

**Position Salary**
  

**Annual Minimum Salary** 055626.00
  

**Annual Mid Range Salary** 066422.00
  

**Annual Maximum Salary** 078628.00
  

**Standard Hours** 37.50
  

**Union Description** HPAE 5094
  

**Payroll Designation** ABP
  

**Benefits**
Rutgers offers a comprehensive benefit program to eligible employees. For details, please go to http://uhr.rutgers.edu/benefits/benefits-overview.  

Rutgers also offers a benefit program to eligible full-time postdoctoral fellow students. For details, please go to https://finance.rutgers.edu/healthcare-risk/insurance/postdoctoral-health-insurance.  

  

**Seniority Unit**
  

**Terms of Appointment** Staff - 12 month
  

**Position Pension Eligibility**  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Bachelor’s Degree plus one (1) year experience required.
* Equivalent education, experience and/or training may be substituted for the educational requirement.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
* Must obtain Food Handler Certification within thirty (30) days.
* Possess a valid driver’s license and access to properly registered vehicle.


  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* Must have a strong commitment to community service as well as interpersonal, organizational, writing, data collection, and reporting skills.
* Excellent computer and Microsoft Office skills.


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) strongly preferred.
* Experience with SNAP a plus.
* Master’s Degree preferred.


  

**Equipment Utilized**
  

**Physical Demands and Work Environment**
* Ability to lift and move containers weighing up to 40 pounds.
* Hybrid work schedule (if applicable) required to be on site for all pantry operational hours.


  

**Special Conditions**
* Required to be on-site Mondays from approximately 11am-2pm and Tuesdays from 10am-4pm.

**Posting Number** 23ST3134
  

**Posting Open Date**

**Department** NJMS-Pharmacology
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Research Teaching Specialist V for NJMS- Pharmacology, Physiology and Neuroscience. Under direction of principal investigator, the Research Teaching Specialist V performs research activities requiring application of standard techniques and procedures.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Perform experiments (for ex, rodents behavioral tests, perfusion, rodents brain sectioning and immunohistochemistry)

* Organizes and maintains experimental records and data of the lab.
* Submits purchase recommendations to his/her supervisor of analytical and physiological equipment and laboratory operating supplies.

title: Postdoctoral Associate
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Postdoctoral Associate
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Research (Laboratory/Non-Laboratory)
  

**Department** NJMS-Pharmacology
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

  

Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.  

  

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.  

  

Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Postdoctoral Associate for NJMS-Pharmacology. The research of the Zhang lab is aimed to identify functional neural circuits in the regulation of motivated behaviors especially social and feeding. To do this, the laboratory uses a combination of novel transgenic mouse lines, optogenetics, chemogenetics, brain slice patch-clamp recording, in vivo fiber photometry and single-cell miniscope imaging, molecular techniques, and mouse models of brain disorders. Under direction of the Principal Investigator, the individual will be responsible for planning and executing experiments independently. The individual will also help train graduate students and technicians  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Performs various research and technical operations relative to ongoing investigatory activities of a laboratory; may conduct independently or as assigned specialized research for a particular project.
* Assists in the conducting of continuous program of research and development regarding new procedures and instrumentation functions of the laboratory.
* Performs highly skilled procedures including stereotactic surgery for brain injection and implantation, in vivo imaging (fiber photometry and miniscope) of freely moving mice, mouse perfusion and slice preparation, immunocytochemistry, RNAscope assay, and behavioral tests.
* Records and analyzes data for studies, maintain accurate records of individual experimentation and research.
* Contributes to writing manuscripts and review articles that directly results from his/her research. Writes and submits abstracts for scientific meetings.
* Assists in training and mentoring graduate students and technicians.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift** Day
  

**Work Arrangement**
  

**FLSA** Exempt
  

**Grade**

**Position Pension Eligibility** ABP
  

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Candidates should hold a recent Ph.D. or an M.D with research experience in neuroscience or a relevant science.


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
* A record of excellence and productivity in research, and the ability to lead work independently are required.
* Experience in stereotactic brain surgery of mice for virus injection and canula implantation, regular behavioral tests, slice patch-clamp recording, and in vivo fiber photometry is preferred.
* Experience in in vivo imaging using miniscope or Mini2P is desired.
* The candidate is expected to be proficient in spoken and written English.

title: Community Liaison-Peer Counselor - WIC
description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Community Liaison-Peer Counselor - WIC
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Healthcare
  

**Department** NJMS-Pediatrics-WIC Program
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

  

Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.  

  

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.  

  

Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Community Liaison – WIC Breastfeeding Program for NJMS- Pediatrics – WIC Program. Under the supervision of the Chief Nutritionist for the WIC Program, Peer counselors provide basic breastfeeding information and encouragement to WIC pregnant and breastfeeding participants. A peer counselor is a paraprofessional who has personal exclusive breastfeeding experience of at least six months, is enthusiastic about breastfeeding, has basic communication skills, has completed the “New Jersey WIC Services Breastfeeding Peer Counselor Training” with a grade of at least 80% on the final exam, and is able to model good parenting and breastfeeding skills.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* As a staff member of the Nutrition Services Component of the WIC Program, interviews pregnant women in the WIC program to obtain needed breastfeeding history.
* Disseminates basic breastfeeding information in the WIC clinic, hospital, home or by phone as needed, either individually or as a member of a team.
* Promotes breastfeeding to prenatal and postpartum women as the normal method of infant feeding; explores any barriers the client may have; help to problem solve and find acceptable solutions.
* Provides peer counseling on common questions about breastfeeding and helps mothers manage common breastfeeding concerns.
* Facilitates discussion groups on breastfeeding and counsels women individually

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift** Day

II, Subpart D, § 246.11, USDA guidance including the Food and Nutrition Services (FNS) Loving Support Model for a Successful Peer Counseling Program and New Jersey WIC Services Policy and Procedures.

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

  

Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.  

  

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.  

  

Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Patient Navigator for NJMS- Infectious Diseases. The primary purpose of the Patient Navigator position is to provide clinic and community-based HIV, STI testing, and case management services to persons with and at risk for HIV infection. Performs a biopsychosocial assessment and develops an informed care plan to address any identified social service needs and treatment adherence barriers. As part of the team, the Patient Navigator will provide services in clinical settings and on the mobile health unit including working select weekend and evening hours. Maintains the confidential integrity of all client level information. Proactively reports any issues requiring action, intervention, or resolution to the Program Manager in a timelymanner.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Provides a confidential assessment for those clients living with HIV and clients being referred for PrEP services determine the HIV prevention needs of the clients whether their test results are positive or negative; this includes the registration and planning of prevention services. 2.
* Provides HIV and STI confidential pre and post-test counseling for identified patients and others according to NJ Department of Health and Senior Services and Centers for Disease Control and Prevention guidelines and documents accordingly.
* Coordinates PrEP and PEP for clients.
* Provides medical case management for newly diagnosed persons with HIV infection
* Determines patient insurance status and/or sliding scale eligibility; assists with processing and advises patients of sliding scale initial/renewal requirements.

  

**Position Status** Full Time
  

**Hours Per Week**
  

**Daily Work Shift**
  

**Work Arrangement**
  

**FLSA** Exempt
  

**Grade** 22S
  

**Position Salary** 60543

Qualifications
**Minimum Education and Experience**
* Bachelor’s Degree in Social Work or Human Services plus two (2) years (five (5) years preferred) of full-time professional experience with HIV/AIDS.
* NJ certification as a HIV Counselor.
  


  

**Certifications/Licenses**
* Valid Driver’s license required.
* Must be able/willing to learn to drive mobile unit.
* Must have completed or be eligible to successfully complete the Rutgers Defensive Driving Training Course.


  

**Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities**
Proficiency in Microsoft Windows based Excel, Access and Word required. Bilingual skills. (English/Spanish) preferred. Ability to exercise considerable independent judgment utilizing professional level of knowledge to establish the work priorities within the scope of responsibility. Excellent and demonstrated customer service skills required. Ability to work varied schedules which may include weekends/ evenings. Incumbent must fulfill all required job qualifications including requirements resulting from current/future modifications to federal/state funding guidelines. **Posting Summary**

The primary purpose of the Nutritionist III position is to work under the direction of the chief nutritionist or designee, implements the nutrition and breast-feeding components of the program. Assesses nutritional needs of participants in the program and provides individual and group nutrition counseling and education in accordance with regulations and guidelines. Collects data and prepares reports required by State and administration. Does outreach to hospital clinics, maternity services and community based organizations.  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Certifies and re-certifies applicants in accordance with policies and procedures.
* Collects, organizes an/or interprets nutrition assessment and socio-economic data on individual participants.
* Develops individual/family nutrition care plans based on assessment of nutritional needs and available sources of nutrients.
* Assists in the development and implementation of the Nutrition Education Plan.
* Prepares curriculum for nutrition education classes and conducts regular classes.
* Evaluates and develops nutrition education literature for distribution to participants.

**Overview**
Rutgers University-Newark, an urban public research university and anchor institution, located in Newark, New Jersey, a city of promise, is seeking an Administrative Assistant for the Department Chemistry of the School of Arts and Sciences (SASN). The Department of Chemistry offers undergraduate major and minor programs in chemistry along with graduate training (M.S. and Ph.D.) in a modern facility with state-of-the-art instrumentation.  


  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers University-Newark (RU-N), an urban public research university and anchor institution, located in Newark, New Jersey, a city of promise is seeking a Head Stock Clerk. Reporting to the Supervisor of Laboratory Instructional Support in the Department of Chemistry, this Head Stock Clerk operates a large stockroom that supports research operations and teaching laboratories.  

  

This position is responsible for and not limited to the following:  

* Operating aspects of a large stockroom and counter operation that supports teaching laboratories and research operations.
* Oversees the receiving storing, and issuing of equipment, materials, and supplies in accordance with federal and state laws.
* Dispenses, distributes, packs, and ships materials, supplies and equipment to multiple locations.
* Ensuring safe laboratory practices in the teaching laboratories.
* Ensuring proper storage, collection, and reporting of chemicals and hazardous waste in the stockroom and teaching laboratories, following Rutgers Environmental Health and Safety (REHS) and New Jersey Right-to-Know (NJRTK) policies, processes, and schedules.

description:
**Position Details**
--------------------


Position Information
**Recruitment/Posting Title** Health Educator III
  

**Job Category** Staff & Executive - Healthcare
  

**Department** NJMS-Pediatrics-Adolescent Medicine
  

**Overview**
New Jersey’s academic health center, Rutgers Biomedical and Health Sciences (RBHS) takes an integrated approach to educating students, providing clinical care, and conducting research, all with the goal of improving human health. Aligned with Rutgers University–New Brunswick and collaborating university wide, RBHS includes eight schools, a behavioral health network, and five centers and institutes that focus on cancer treatment and research, neuroscience, advanced biotechnology and medicine, environmental and occupational health, and health care policy and aging research.  

  

Our faculty are teachers, clinicians, and scientists with unparalleled experience who advance medical innovation and provide patient care informed by the latest research findings. We offer an outstanding education in medicine, dentistry, pharmacy, public health, nursing, biomedical research, and the full spectrum of allied health careers.  

  

Our clinical and academic facilities are located throughout the state—at Rutgers University–New Brunswick, including Piscataway; and at locations in Newark, Scotch Plains, Somerset, Stratford, and other locations. Clinical partners include Robert Wood Johnson University Hospital in New Brunswick, Newark’s University Hospital in Newark, and other affiliates.  

  

Through this community of healers, scientists, and scholars, Rutgers is equipped as never before to transform lives.
  

**Posting Summary**
Rutgers, The State University of New Jersey, is seeking a Health Educator III for NJMS- Pediatrics. The Health Educator III is responsible for stimulating public awareness of health needs, sound health practices, hospital and community resources. Promotes public awareness of HIV and STI for prevention and improved public health status. Conducts outreach and case management to clients that are lost to care and links those who are newly diagnosed with HIV to appropriate care and treatment programs. Provides HIV counseling (ARTAS), testing and referrals for clients receiving services on the STOP mobile unit and on-site. Serves as lead HIV Pre-Exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP) Counselor. Participates in the Youth Advisory Board (YAB)  

  

Among the key duties of this position are the following:* Studies and assesses health education needs of the community and analyzes the knowledge, interactions, beliefs, and practices of people in the community to identify populations at risk of HIV infection and determine possible barriers to health education processes.
* Applies the CDC’s Social Networking Strategy utilized to recruit clients for program participation and referrals for HIV testing.
* Provides outreach to HIV positive individuals who are lost to care. Links those who are newly diagnosed to services and resources.
* Assess and identify individuals that would benefit from PrEP and initiate referrals for treatment when appropriate. Maintains PrEP Counselor certification.
* Serves as lead PrEP counselor including sessions, data entry and management in PrEP database, and PrEP monthly report.
* Provides family planning counseling to identify high-risk individuals in need of additional services

**Hours Per Week**

title: Procurement Specialist
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------


Champion Container Corp is a growing distribution company of industrial packaging supplies is looking for an ideal candidate to join our growing purchasing department. Champion Container is searching for experienced candidates for the position of procurement specialist. If you are looking for a career and not just a job, you are in the right place@ currently seeking an individual with purchasing experience and excellent communication skills for a full-time purchasing assistant position.


Our ideal candidate has strong attention to detail and good computer skills, as well as a professional demeanor, flexibility, and reliability. We provide an excellent salary and a comprehensive benefits package. Hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00-4:30pm. No overtime or weekend requirements.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Processing Paperwork for Incoming and Out-Going Shipments
* Heavy Computer Work and Follow up with Vendors
* Interaction with multiple Warehouses
* Support of Purchasing Staff
* Ensure any necessary paperwork is processed correctly and efficiently
* Where appropriate, forecast demand and assure material supplies support needs
* Perform functions associated with purchase order submission and payment
* Establish, build and maintain relationships with key suppliers
* Ananyze and enter price changes in the system
* Maintains up-to-date knowledge of all products
* Assist in the completion of counting, entering and verifying physical inventory for daily cycle counts
* Maintain strict confidentiality of all information relating to pricing, sales and customer information

title: Admission Representative
description:
**Title:** Admissions Representative

**Classification:** Staff

**Area and Function:** Under the supervision of the Campus Director or designee, Admissions Representatives are responsible for working with future students. The process includes all phases of the Admissions process from marketing the program to qualifying candidates for enrollment. The Advisor resolves most enrollment questions and problems and refers only the most complex issues to higher levels.

**The duties and responsibilities of the position are outlined below:**

* Reports directly to the Campus Director and Admissions Director
* Recruits students ensuring full and complete class enrollment on a semester basis
* Interviews prospective students
* Processes applications and enrollment documents
* Implements goals and objectives of the Admission Department
* Submits weekly reports in a timely manner
* Conducts operations in accordance with administrative compliance requirements as mandated by New Jersey Higher Education and the Accrediting Commission of Career Schools and Colleges
* Other assigned tasks requested by the Campus Director and/or President

Eastern International College is committed to the education and professional enrichment of all its students. Under no circumstances does Eastern International College enroll students under false or misleading assumptions about their future earnings. In addition to the responsibilities outlined in the job description, Admissions representatives are required to:

* Refrain from offering misleading information
* Make no guarantees of a job upon graduation
* Make no guarantees of any certain salary a student will earn upon graduation

Employees' performance will be evaluated after a 90-day probationary period.

As an Employee for Eastern International College, Admissions Representatives may be required to work at either campus based on student need. Additionally, you are expected to be available for evening and weekend coverage of the Admissions Department upon request and/or scheduled appointments.

title: Teacher Assistant - Infants (Full-time)
description:
In 2008, World of Wonder Childcare Center established itself in the Southwest area of Hoboken. After eight years, we expanded into our 2nd location, and in early 2023, we opened our 3rd center. We are proud of our reputation in town and work endlessly to maintain a loving and fun environment for the children, their parents, and our staff.

We are hiring! We seek bright, passionate, dependable people who love children to join our team! We offer an exciting, fun, inclusive, and growth-oriented work environment. Experience is preferred, but we are happy to train the right candidate. New hires receive on-the-job training.

If you love taking care of infants! We would love to talk to you.

**What we offer?**

* Vacation
* Birthday Paid Off
* Sick Time off (up to 40 hours per year)
* Holidays Paid Off
* Paid Training
* Professional Development
* Employee referral program
* Health, Vision and Dental benefits
* Year-end Bonus
* 401K match
* Potential for growth

**Desired personality?**

* Fun, energetic, pro-active, and great team player
* Responsible and committed
* Great communication and top-notch customer service skills

**How do we best define our culture?**

* Community
* Connection
* Respect
* Integrity
* Teamwork
* Love & Fun

**Who are we looking for?**

Full-time Teachers Assistant from:

* 9:30am - 6:30pm

**What will you help us with?**

* Is responsible for the overall supervision and daily class functions of a group of children.
* Observes all rules and regulations at World of Wonder and the local, state or national regulatory agencies pertaining to the health, safety and care of children.
* Assesses each child's developmental needs on an ongoing basis.
* Implements the approved lesson plans and daily classroom schedule.
* Plans with a member of the Leadership Team the parent-teacher conferences and student evaluations.
* Maintains an attractive, well-kept classroom that encourages children to create, explore and make decisions with confidence.
* Provides verbal recognition and acceptance to children while providing clear and consistent expectations for the children's behavior.
* Accepts responsibility for maintenance and necessary housekeeping duties of the classroom, common use areas and playgrounds.
* Attends all required staff meetings, workshops and/or school functions.
* Maintains overall professional personal appearance adhering to the guidelines offered in the World Of Wonder Childcare Center.

**What do we require?**

* Willing to obtain CPR & First Aid within the first 30 days.
* Highschool diploma, CDA, AA, and BA (preferred)
* must be available to work 30 weekly hours
* Agree to 7:30 am – 1:00 pm or 1:00 pm - 6:30 pm schedule for the first year of employment

**Center Details:**

* Open Monday - Friday
* 7:30 am - 6:30 pm
* Closed nights, weekends and 14 major holidays

**What is our interview process?**

* Send us our resume!
* Upon reviewing your resume, a Virtual meeting with Owner or Director of the center will be scheduled.
* If requested submit homework
* If requested, submit 2 references and schedule a working interview. Working interview takes place Monday-Friday and lasts 3 hours.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Classroom Support:**

* Assist the lead teacher in implementing developmentally appropriate curriculum and activities that align with the childcare center's educational goals.
* Engage children in play, learning, and creative activities that promote their cognitive, social, emotional, and physical growth.

**Child Interaction and Supervision:**

* Build positive relationships with children, providing emotional support, guidance, and encouragement.
* Supervise children during various activities, transitions, and free play to ensure their safety and well-being.

**Assessment and Progress Tracking:**

* Observe and record children's behavior, interactions, and progress, sharing this information with the lead teacher.
* Assist in maintaining accurate records of children's accomplishments and challenges.

**Classroom Organization:**

* Help maintain a clean, organized, and welcoming classroom environment that encourages learning and exploration.
* Set up and prepare materials and resources for various activities, ensuring they are age-appropriate and accessible.
* **Assistance with Routine Tasks:**
* Assist children with tasks such as eating, dressing, and toileting while fostering their independence.
* Support lead teacher in managing classroom routines, transitions, and daily schedules.

**Parent Communication:**

* Maintain open communication with parents or guardians, sharing information about their child's daily experiences, progress, and any concerns.

**Team Collaboration:**

* Collaborate closely with the lead teacher, other teacher assistants, and support staff to create a cohesive and positive team environment.
* Contribute ideas and suggestions to enhance the classroom experience for children.

**Health and Safety:**

* Adhere to health and safety protocols, including maintaining cleanliness, sanitization, and proper hygiene practices.
* Assist in ensuring the safety and well-being of children during outdoor play, field trips, and other activities.

NOTE: NO SMOKING in working clothes - This is due to health & safety violation of our No Smoking Policy

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Transfer Analyst
description:
Description:
**Located on a beautiful campus in Union, New Jersey, our state-of-the-art monitoring center facility is the most advanced in the United States. The team at Affiliated Monitoring protects millions of people by monitoring their security alarms and medical alert systems.**

**Our team currently has an opening for a Junior Data Analyst.** **Working as part of our Transfer Implementation Team, this critical role is instrumental in analyzing and processing data for new business conversions for life safety monitoring.** **You will be interpreting and implementing data from partners ranging from nationally recognized security, PERS and IoT providers to unique technology startups.**

**This position requires critical thinking and problem-solving skills.**

**What You’ll Do:**

* Performs in-depth data analysis, data-mining, data importing, data entry, and report generation
* Validating, transferring, and reconciling data from various platforms
* Maintain accuracy in a fast-paced environment
* Works with other teams to gather and understand reporting/data requirements and delivers reporting/data requests in a timely fashion
* Coordinates and prioritizes tasks with senior team members and manager
* Works with the client-facing Onboarding/Implementation team to successfully transition new B2B partners
* Conducts post import analysis/QA
* Collaborate within our organization to provide the best partner experience


Requirements:
**What We’re Looking For:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Informatics, Business Administration, Business, or similar preferred
* Experience in MS Excel is required, preferably working with large volumes of data
* Experience with database query skills preferred. SQL Server background a plus
* Experience working with MS Project, Monday.com a plus
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and constantly evolving environment while managing shifting priorities
* Desire to seek continuous training and personal development opportunities

**What's In It for You?**

* Competitive pay and comprehensive benefits package
* Chance to work with an experienced and talented team
* Entrepreneurial work environment with the freedom to get things done
* Make a true impact on our company and products with high-visibility and possibilities for career growth

**Benefits and Perks**

* Excellent Comprehensive Insurance Coverage
* 401(k)
* Retirement Savings
* Gym/Fitness Program Reimbursement
* Access to Corporate Discounts
* Commuter Benefits
* Company Paid Life Insurance
* And much more…

title: Physical Therapy Aide
description:
If you’re looking for a rewarding career that contributes to helping people restore their active, pain-free lives, consider joining the Kayal Orthopedic Center team. We have exciting opportunities for a PT Aide to work in our Kinnelon Office. The hours are as follows:

Mon-Fri 1pm-7pm, with rotational Saturdays from 8am-1pm. About 1 or 2 Saturdays a month.

***Job Duties:***

Assist with patient intake

Observe patients, document patients responses and progress

Liaise with physicians' offices and hospital personnel

Prepare treatment room for patient by following prescribed procedures and protocols.

Prepare patients for physical treatment, educate patients by demonstrating proper use of equipment and exercises.

Help assist the Physician Therapist and Physician Therapy Assistant by providing heat packs, paraffin dips.

Help patients onto exercise equipment, monitor motion, track walking time and distance, measure mobility, perform prescribed exercises and strengthening techniques.

Maintain safe and clean working environment by following procedures, rules and regulations i.e. clean beds, gym equipment, PT modalities.

Ensure operation of physical therapy equipment, complete preventive maintenance, call for repairs.

Maintain physical therapy supplies inventory, anticipate needs, place and expedite orders.

When you join one of our 17 convenient locations, you become a part of Kayal Orthopedic Center unrivaled record of achievement, education and advancement as we revolutionize healthcare together. We work hard to acquire and retain the best people, and to create a welcoming, nurturing work environment where you can develop professionally. We share the belief that all employees, regardless of job title or expertise, can make an impact on quality patient care.

title: Merchandise Manager
description:
At Five Below our growth is a result of the people who embrace our purpose: We know life is way better when you are free to Let Go & Have Fun in an amazing experience, filled with unlimited possibilities, priced so low, you can always say yes to the newest, coolest stuff! Just ask any of our over 17,000 associates who work at Five Below and they’ll tell you there’s no other place like it. It all starts with our purpose and then, The Five Below Way, which is our values and behaviors that each and every associate believes in.


It’s all about culture at Five Below, making this a place that can inspire you as much as you inspire us with big ideas, super energy, passion, and the ability to make the workplace a WOWplace!


**What does the Merchandise Manager do?**

Under the leadership of the Store Manager, directly leads the Freight team, and all associates of the store while the Manager on Duty. The Merchandise Manager (MM) is responsible for executing merchandising standards throughout the store. The Merchandise Manager is also responsible to “Wow the Customer”, operational controls, inventory integrity, asset protection, cleanliness, safety and driving sales.


**How do they do it?**

As a Five Below leader, your first priority is to contribute to the success of your store. This means that you not only deliver in your role as the Merchandise Manager, but you also model leadership behaviors and deliver as a manager on duty. As the Manager on Duty, you deliver results during your assigned time, drive key performance indicators and brand loyalty by leading through your team. The Merchandise Manager is part of the management team that sets the tone by embracing and living the Five Below Value! These values translate into creating the coolest brand on the plant, where talented people want to grow their careers…and here is how!


***Wow the Customer*** : Put the customer first and make a difference in people’s lives


***Unleash Passion*** : Check your ego at the door and do what you say you will do


***Hold the Penny Hostage*** : Treat Five Below like your own business and hire talent that will do the same


***Achieve the Impossible*** : Set the bar high for self and team and make sure to take risks


***Work Hard, Have Fun, Build a Career*** : Come to work ready to take on the day, create a fun atmosphere and recognize the team for all the efforts


**Key Attributes of MM:**

* Leadership
* Trainer/Developer/Motivator
* Communication
* Ownership/Commitment
* Accountability/Delegation/Follow Up
* Sales Driver/Goal Oriented
* Professionalism
* Emerging Skill - Planning/Time Management

**RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Ensures Merchandise Movement Process is flawlessly executed
* Responsible for merchandising, signing, and resets in Now, Style, Room, Tech, and Party
* Responsible for opening and closing store procedures
* Responsible for performing SM duties in their absence
* Assists in supervising all Associates
* Assists in training all Associates
* Assists in coaching all Associates
* Assists in developing all Associates
* Assists in staff scheduling
* Reviews all corporate communications and reacts accordingly
* Partners with supervisors or corporate office regarding store issues
* Drives store sales and controls expenses
* Drives store sales which may include performing in all Five Below services (ear piercing, balloons, buy online pick up in store, etc.)
* Uses financial reporting to drive business opportunities
* Assists payroll process and ensures budget is in line with plan
* Assists in merchandising procedures
* Responsible for maintaining assigned zone
* Sets and maintains Market Plan, Signage, and other Merchandise Sets
* Ensures the execution of company Inventory Integrity process
* Adheres to and holds associates accountable to all Five Below’s Standard Operating Procedures(SOP)
* Responsible for cash handling procedures including but not limited to preparing and dropping bank deposits
* Authorizes register functions including post voids, returns and discounts
* Complies with Human Resources policies and procedures
* Leads Asset Protection and Safety processes and holds associates accountable
* Delivers exceptional customer service through personal contact with customers
* Assists in receiving and stocking procedures
* Unloads merchandise from trucks
* Checks in shipments
* Stages merchandise for the sales floor
* Packs out merchandise
* Leads and ensures Five Below’s Packaway Process is completed within timeframes provided
* Performs store maintenance including but not limited to taking out garbage, sweeping, cleaning bathrooms, maintaining stock room

This job description is not all-inclusive. Additional responsibilities will be determined by the Store Manager, as dictated by store needs.


**Key Measurables:**

* Sales
* AP Audits
* Shrink Results
* Expense Control
* ADS
* CSAT scores

**Essential Job Functions:**

* Frequently operate cash register
* Frequently move merchandise weighing up to 25 lbs and places/removes merchandise up to a height of 5-10 feet
* Frequently ascend/descend ladders in order to retrieve and put away stock
* Frequently position self to kneel, bend, twist, and stoop, including in the stock room and on the sales floor
* Frequently communicate and exchange information with customers on the telephone and face-to-face in the store, as well as with managers and coworkers. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations
* Frequently move across the sales floor assisting customers, as well as to and from the stock room retrieving and putting away merchandise
* Must be able to identify and discern email and print instructions regarding merchandise layouts, associate schedules, and standard operating procedures
* Must be able to remain in a stationary, upright position for 80% of the time

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* High School Graduate or equivalent.
* College experience preferred
* Minimum 2 years of management experience
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Ability to multi-task
* Creative thinking
* Ability to maintain composure under pressure

If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us!


Five Below is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


**Position Type:**

Hourly
BE AWARE OF FRAUD! Please be aware of potentially fraudulent job postings or suspicious recruiter activity by persons that are posing as a Five Below recruiters. Please confirm that the person you are working with has an @ fivebelow.com email address. Additionally, Five Below does NOT request financial information or payments from candidates at any point during the hiring process. If you suspect fraudulent activity, please visit Five Below’s Careers Site at www.fivebelow.com/info/careers to verify the posting.

title: Cell Culture Specialist
company: Tisch Multiple Sclerosis Research Center of New York
description:
The **Regenerative Medicine Laboratory** at the **Tisch MS Research Center of New York** is seeking a Cell Culture Specialist for cGMP manufacturing of autologous human cell therapy products currently undergoing clinical trial testing to treat multiple sclerosis. The position represents an exciting opportunity to join the Tisch MS Research Center of New York, an independent research center dedicated to finding the cause of and a cure for multiple sclerosis.

**Main Job Tasks and Responsibilities**

* Perform all tasks associated with the sterile manufacture of autologous mesenchymal stem cell-derived clinical cell product following batch records and SOPs
* Perform cell processing using appropriate aseptic technique within an isolator/clean room environment.
* Prepare reagents in support of cell culture and routine analytical testing
* Maintain inventory logs for necessary cell culture reagents and supplies
* Strictly adhere to SOPs and cGMP regulations, and accurately complete documentation associated with clinical manufacturing
* Work as part of a team to execute cGMP runs in close collaboration with QA and cell manufacturing managers
* Perform daily environmental monitoring

**Education and Experience**

* Requires bachelors degree and/or advanced degree in biological sciences
* At least 1 year of laboratory experience and aseptic cell culture is required
* Knowledge of cGMP is preferred
* Experience working in clean room environment is preferred
* Exceptional organizational and time-management skills required. Candidate should be a detail-oriented individual with above average written and oral communication skills in English.

We offer a very competitive salary and benefits in a pleasant and professional work environment. Please apply with a cover letter and resume. Names of 3 references must be provided on request.

Work Remotely

Pay: $60,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Product Manager
description:
**Title:** Product Manager

**Location:** DocGo HQ - 35 West 35th Street, New York, NY 10001

**Salary Range:** $100,000 - $130,000 annually

**Employment Type:** Full-Time, On-Site

**Benefits:** Medical, Dental, and Vision (with company contribution), Paid Time Off, 401k

 **About** **DocGo****:**


DocGo is leading the proactive healthcare revolution with an innovative care delivery platform that includes mobile health services, population health, remote patient monitoring, and ambulance services. DocGo disrupts the traditional four-wall healthcare system by providing high quality, highly affordable care to patients where and when they need it. DocGo's proprietary, AI-powered technology, logistics network, and dedicated field staff of over 5,000 certified health professionals elevate the quality of patient care and drive efficiencies for municipalities, hospital networks, and health insurance providers. With Mobile Health, DocGo empowers the full promise and potential of telehealth by facilitating healthcare treatment, in tandem with a remote physician, in the comfort of a patient's home or workplace. Together with DocGo's integrated Ambulnz medical transport services, DocGo is bridging the gap between physical and virtual care.

**About the role:**


The Product Manager - Medical Transportation will lead the development and continuous improvement of DocGo’s proprietary software supporting our medical transportation division. This role works closely with EMS professionals, dispatch teams, and cross-functional stakeholders to ensure that our transportation products meet the highest standards for reliability, and efficiency. The ideal candidate has experience in the health tech field or EMS field and a deep understanding of the complexities of healthcare systems and their workflows. You will be responsible for managing the lifecycle of Medical Transportation software products, from ideation and development to deployment and scaling, ensuring that our digital solutions meet the evolving demands of the market and enhance patient care outcomes.

 **Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Collaborate with EMS professionals, dispatchers, operations teams, and leadership to gather insights and identify areas for product development.
* Manage the entire product lifecycle, from ideation and development to implementation and scaling.
* Collaborate with engineering, operations, and data teams to define and prioritize and steer development of product features and reporting.
* Conduct market research and competitor analysis to ensure our services are competitive and continuously evolving.
* Lead the implementation of new features or services, ensuring a seamless integration with existing operations and workflows.
* Monitor KPIs and gather feedback from stakeholders, patients, and field teams to refine and improve the transportation product.
* Collaborate with sales and marketing teams to develop strategies for promoting our technology to new and existing customers.
* Prepare reports, presentations, and documentation on product performance, recommendations, and enhancements.
* Facilitate Demos of the technology to respective stakeholders.
 **Requirements and Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree preferred but not required.
* Willingness to travel up to 10% of the year for business needs, including site visits, meetings, and conferences.
* 1-3 years of product management experience, with a preference for candidates who have worked in health tech.
* Strong communication skills with the ability to work cross-functionally with teams such as operations, engineering, and marketing.
* Strong analytical skills to evaluate product performance and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Proficiency in software development lifecycle management and tools such as JIRA, Confluence, or similar platforms.
* Experience working with technical details, process flows, data analysis, platform integrations, and workflow automation.
* Experience in creating product strategies, identifying opportunities, and translating them into product initiatives and user stories.
* Ability to communicate clearly and build positive relationships across different parts of the organization.
* Familiarity with agile methodologies and iterative approaches to managing product lifecycles.
* Experience balancing data analysis and intuition in product decision-making, with a proven record of success.
 **Bonus:**

* Experience working as an EMS professional, dispatcher, or in another relevant operational role within medical transportation.

EEO/AAP Statement: DocGo is an equal opportunity employer. We acknowledge and honor the fundamental value and dignity of all individuals. We pledge ourselves to crafting and maintaining an environment that respects diverse traditions, heritages, and experiences. DocGo is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

*The above-noted job description is not intended to describe, in detail, the multitude of tasks that may be assigned but rather to give the applicant a general sense of the responsibilities and expectations of this position. As the nature of business demands change so, too, may the essential functions of the position.*

title: Maintenance Supervisor 1 (Plumbing Shop)
description:
**Maintenance Supervisor 1 (Plumbing Shop)**


**Required Qualifications:** Per Civil Service Standards and Specifications. One year of trade experience subsequent to the completion of an apprenticeship or equivalent training and experience such as that required for a Trades Specialist (Carpenter), Trades Specialist (Electrician), Service & Repair Mechanic (Electronics), Trades Generalist, Grounds Construction Supervisor, Trades Specialist (Locksmith), Trades Specialist (Machinist), Trades Specialist (Mason & Plasterer), Service & Repair Mechanic (Motor Equipment), Trades Specialist (Painter), Trades Specialist (Plumber & Steamfitter), Service & Repair Mechanic (HVAC-R), Trades Specialist (Roofing), or Trades Specialist (Welder). Candidate must be able to perform the physical tasks of the position such as bending, lifting, stretching and climbing. Must have the ability to work in confined spaces and from a ladder, scaffolding or man lift over ten feet in height. Must have, keep and maintain the appropriate valid NYS Driver’s License; have a motor vehicle record which is free from major violations or a pattern of repeat violations. (\\*\\*\\*Out-of-State Applicants, see "Special Notes”). Must be available and respond promptly in the event of emergencies or when needed.


**Preferred Qualifications:** 10 years of trade’s experience in the plumbing trade. Experience supervising staff. Strong computer skills including MS word, Excel, experience with CMMS (Infor – work order system). Experience with email communications.


**Brief Description of Duties:** The Maintenance Supervisor 1 is responsible for supervising and coordinating the activities for the plumbing shop. This position is a working supervisor position, where you plan and lay out work, assign staff, provide instruction and assistance, and inspect work. The Maintenance Supervisor will need to have knowledge of OSHA, PESH and safety Regulations. The selected candidate will be responsible for the following.


* Supervise various types of skilled/semi-skilled employees. Observes, assist, and inspect work while in progress and when completed to ensure that specific codes and regulations are followed, materials and equipment are used properly, schedules are met, and work is performed according to plan and schedule. Ensure preventive maintenance is being kept up on equipment and buildings.
* Prepares and maintains written and electronic (INFOR) records of work performed, completed, and accounts for labor and material used. Prepare reports of job progress, including employee time, material, supplies, equipment, and work completed.
* Reviews all work orders, blueprints, and specifications and, as required, visits the project site to determine dimensions, materials, and labor required to complete the project.
* Prepares rough sketches or plans to scale from oral or written instructions.
* Plan, organize and assign daily and emergency work. Assigns staff to the project and provides oral instructions and blueprints, specifications, and plans. Prepare schedules and work orders using the electronic INFOR CMMS system.
* Meets with supervisors representing other trades involved in the projects to coordinate activities and schedule work to be performed to ensure the effective utilization of staff, materials, and equipment, and completion of the project on schedule.
* As assigned, inspect work performed by outside contractors to ensure conformance with project specifications.
* Supervise, train, and evaluate subordinate personnel. Prepare, review and sign employees' timesheets. Prepare performance evaluations, counseling, and overtime requests. Keep records regarding area equipment, tools, materials, and supplies.
* Other duties or projects as assigned as appropriate to rank and departmental mission.


**Special Notes:** This is a full-time position, 40 hours per week, Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. FLSA Nonexempt position, eligible for the overtime provisions of the FLSA. Internal and external search to occur simultaneously. Mandatory rehire roster candidates have preference. SG 14 Hiring Rate $54,860, Job Rate $66,634. This position includes location pay of $3,400, annually.



The selected candidate must successfully clear a background investigation.



Resume/CV and cover letter should be included with the online application.


**For this position, we are unable to sponsor candidates for work visas.**


*Seniority for promotion is the length of service in the Operational Services Bargaining Unit. Seniority applies to vacant non-competitive class positions in salary grades higher than the applicants grade.*

*Applicants must meet the posted qualifications/job requirements, legitimate operating needs of the department and have the ability to perform duties and responsibilities satisfactorily.At time of submission, candidates must include all relevant work experience and training/education information. Submissions failing to do so, will not be considered.*

*T**ime and attendance, past evaluations, disciplinary history and the ability to perform the physical and supervisory aspects of this position will be considered as part of the selection process. Verifiable proof of credentials as stated above are the responsibility of the applicant. Please be prepared to document proof of qualifications with application.*


**Essential Position:** This has been designated as an essential position based on the duties of the job and the functions performed. Positions that are designated as such are required to report to work/remain at work even if classes are canceled, and the campus is working on limited operations in an emergency.

title: In House Marketing
description:
**Job Title:** In-House Marketer

**Hours:** Monday through Friday 8:30am-4:30pm

**Who we are:**

We are a group of dedicated individuals whose goal is to provide care that is tailored to meet the specific needs of first responders, educators, county, municipal, and administrative workers. Through the **Save My Life Program**, frontline workers receive comprehensive and extensive testing so they can be at their healthiest when they are serving our communities. By using our program, essential workers and their families can have peace of mind by limiting the occupational risks to only those mentioned in the job description.

**Job Summary**: Our In-House Marketers reach out to various departments through cold calling and email marketing to generate leads and schedule information sessions.

**Essential Functions (Duties/Responsibilities)**

* Conduct outbound cold calls to targeted prospects to generate new business opportunities.
* Plan and execute email marketing campaigns to nurture leads, retain customers, and drive conversions.
* Monitor email campaign metrics and implement improvements based on performance data
* Conduct market research to stay informed about industry trends, competitor activities, and customer preferences.
* Utilize market insights to refine marketing strategies and tactics
* Ensure consistency in brand messaging across all channels and materials.
* Contribute to the development and maintenance of brand guidelines.
* Reach KPI goals on a daily and weekly basis
* Other duties as assigned

**Knowledge Skills and Abilities:**

* Strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team and independently
* Persistence and resilience in handling rejection and overcoming objections.
* Knowledge of the product or service being offered and the industry.
* Self-motivated and driven
* Exceptional time-management and organizational skills

**Education/ Experience**

* Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or a related field.
* Proven experience in marketing or sales role
* Proven experience in outbound cold calling, lead generation, or telemarketing.
* Knowledge of marketing tools, techniques and best practices

**Physical Requirements**

* Extended periods of sitting and computer use are common in office-based roles.
